review: The bandit wouldn't stay put...at all.  How could it help my lower belly when it kept riding up to the smallest part of my waist?!  It was really frustrating.  I still wore it for about 4 weeks but measured my lower tummy weekly and it wasn't getting any smaller so I finally gave up.  It also got this permanent fold in it that wouldn't go away.  I suppose if you have zero curves (and definitely no butt), it might work but it didn't work at all for me.
I am wearing my Bandit now. It made my belly get back to its shape sooner by supporting weak muscles and pushing it. It worked for me. Do measure yourself. I have the Xsmall even my clothing is XL.

i was so excited to get to order this while i was still pregnant, and planned to use it from the day of birth thru 6 or 8 weeks.  i was QUITE disappointed when it was FAR from fitting me at the hospital.  i ordered a cheaper abdominal binder off amazon after a few days of the BB still not fitting me.  it was great- 4 days later i was able to get in to the BB and i was excited to switch.  i've been wearing the BB for 3 days now and i am still quite disappointed in it.  it bunches and rides up my back (making it completely noticable under even jeans and a tshirt), its incredibly uncomfortable (more so than just squishing all my insides LOL), i'm constantly pulling it down and almost have to re-do it every time i sit/stand up.  i will say that it does seem to be working w/ the squishing the belly back down, but so did the much cheaper alternative (and it was actually semi-comfortable).  i would definitely recommend the cheaper belt over this one to any of my friends.

I was very skeptical about purchasing this but since I needed results fast since I was a bridesmaid in a wedding 2 months post partum, I thought I would try it!

After only ONE week of wearing this, I was able to fit into a few pairs of pre pregnancy jeans and back in my pre pregnancy shirts!  I am not joking either!  This product did the job it claims to do!!!  It also provided excelent back and tummy support needed after delivering a baby, I felt great!  It is also helping with my stretched out skin and stretch marks.  I cannot say enough good about this product! My only gripe is that it buckles and creases after wearing it 24/7 and after washing, it doesnt uncrease...oh well.  It still did its job and I have confidence only one week post partum!!!  GET IT!

I ordered the XL in the Belly Bandit because that is the size I normally wear when not pregnant. I am 5'10" and an athletic build with a larger bust. I felt like I couldn't get the Bandit tight enough to suck me in and it made me really hot. I don't know if it is because the Belly bandit uses velcro but I just didn't feel it was effecient at what it was suppose to be doing. I thought my spanx did a better job at holding me in than this and was easier to move around in. I think I wore it twice and was over it. Wasted my money!

I bought 2 bandits, one small & one xs, I worn the small for the first 4 days after delivery (41 inch waist just before labour) then I moved on to the xs, after 9 days my stomach was flat. It's now been 12 days since my baby was born & i have 2 inches to go to get back to my pre-pregnancy waist size (26 inches). I found this product very comfortable to wear (even to sleep in) it's ok to wear under loser fitting clothes but shows under tight shirts.

I bought it for my sister and she loves it... Even thou I didn't know much about these things... But she mentions that it is a great product, very soft, not scratchy and make her feel very comfortable.

I bought this bandit in the hopes that I could wear it as described.  The box says to wear it day and night, except to shower.  Well, it dug into my ribs when I was sitting up in bed nursing, and it rolled up under my clothes, so it became impractical to wear all the time.  Eventually, I just began to forget wearing it, so I basically wasted $45.00.

I want to love this product as I had such high hopes for it based on other reviews Ive read however I have tried to use this for a few weeks now and its just not made for tall women.

The band doesnt cover the area it needs to in order to be effective. If I wear it low It gives me major back fat and if I wear it high my lower abdomen is completely uncovered.

I wouldnt recommend if you're tall or have a long torso. I am 510.

FYI I did buy the correct size. I checked it on their website and contacted their customer service department to be sure.

Waste of money. Im hourglass shape trying to get rid of the post baby belly budge and this thing just kept Migrating to right under my boobs. So uncomfortable.
How do they claim this is for an hourglass shape??? No way. Its horrible sitting while wearing this. Only buy this if you have no hips.

Extremely uncomfortable. Tried two different sizes but couldn't wear it for more than 10 minutes at a time. It either pushes extra fat out the top or bottom, and pinches when I try to sit. Impossible to nurse while wearing. I'll just stick with the eating right/working out to lose the gut, which appears to be working fine.
Sizing on this is completely off. Doesnt fit at all. Didnt gain any weight during my pregnancy and had my baby 14 weeks early and still didn't fit into the size they said I would :(

followed the sizing chart diligently and bought it for postpartum.  by the time it was time to put it on it was too small and i couldn't return or exchange it.  if you decide to buy this wait until a week after you give birth

I originally purchased this item in a size small but come to find out only after 24 hours I really needed a size Extra Small. I really love the results I'm getting from this product but there are a few things about it that are a bit annoying. The material is nice and firm which makes the product really have great results but as your waist is smaller than your rib cage area and hips, the band will fold. Once it folds it has a permanent fold in the band. Every time you wear it this fold will be present which causes the band to slide up in the back above the butt. I continue to wear it but I am constantly pulling it down in the back and it will immediately move right back up. My waist line is great just 4 weeks after childbirth, I give a lot of credit to this product and breastfeeding, but there are just a few annoyances you will have to deal with. FYI I wore this 24/7 except for when I showered.

Shipped quick and product was just as advertised. Giving 4 stars for the band itself. Its grear as long as Im standing and moving. But if I sit or lay it rolls up and is difficult to reposition especially if you have a newborn in hand.

This did its job, but maybe I expected more. It creased right away, and the creases never straightened out so it stopped serving its purpose, almost. But, it did help when I wore it several hours a day. I was only able to get about one month use out of it.
helped me with lower back support after giving birth, highly recommended
Really helps my stomach to feel tight and help my stomach to look flat.
I got this for my girlfriend because it was on her registry she loved it.

I'm 2 weeks postpartum and bought this for the flabby tummy. I have wide hips and a smallish waist, and this thing just won't stay in place. Every time I sit, it rides way up, and even bending causes it to slip. I've had it one day and think I'll have to return.

Great belly wrap. It does the job youll see progress in a few days. For me i wore this 3days postpartum it did help shrink my tummy in less than a week but then after that it just stays that way there was no more additional progress. Good quality wrap as well. But i think price is too much for something u will only use for say about a month. Well depends on every woman. This is my review.

I felt this product ran a little small, but it is supposed to be tighter. I slept in mine a lot, but I found myself waking up in a dripping sweat, so I wouldn't recommend wearing at night. Great to wear around the house and helps things tighten up a bit after the trauma of giving birth.
Really helped me with my diastasis recti after I had my baby! Helped so much with back and belly pain from sore muscles after delivery.  Sizing was spot on
Returned I purchased as a gift and the person didn't want.

I ordered large. A small was delivered. I returned the product. If a company cant get this one basic process correct then I am not wasting anymore time on them. In the end I was better off not using the band. My muscles seem to have recovered pretty well after my cesarean operation.

The band seemed pretty sturdy, but was almost too thick to be comfortable under clothes.
Cinched ok when not sitting or bending.  Rolled up and gathered/bunched up quickly.  Ok of you have no waist.  Didn't work for me at all.

I'm 10 days postpartum with our second child, and I can button my pre-pregnancy jeans. Sweet!

Sizing Note: I was right on the border between two sizes, so I sized down. I had to wait a few days to wear it, but it will be more useful to me in the long term.
Wife bought it, and she likes it quite a bit.
This product futs great. Was very snug the first day...but as it does its job and my belly gets smaller it fits better and better!

I ordered this based on the companys sizing chart, it ended up being a whole size too big. After returning and ordering a Small, I had good results. One con would be that the material creases easily and bunches up. I ended up rotating the band so that the Velcro closure was on the back and it helped somewhat.
Want to return! It does not fit and you can feel & hearvthe Velcro while wearing it.

One of the reviews I read before purchasing was this stated that the fit was wrong, if you use the sizing chart on Amazon, yes, that is correct - you will get the wrong size.  Go directly to the Belly Bandit website and use that sizing chart and you will get the correct size.  I love this, so far.  Only had it for a few days but is helping my back tremendously.

I got an extra small since I was between sizes and this fit me a couple days after delivery. I don't wear it all the time, but I wear it while Im bed. It feels really good when I wear it. My backs been hurting after the delivery.
So impressed by this product! Very comfortable and it really works well. I didn't start using it until 5 weeks PP but still feel it was worth the money.

Yes I had received a package,but package was all open ,I am not happy about ,I think a item is not a new item I would like To return then ,I always buys onlime though amazon if you want me continue to buy then please unopened package or use item
I loved the material but the sizing is horrible... I bought a large based on the sizing chart I was only about to wear for 3 days after now it's just too loose. Supports nothing.
Stretched out within the first week I wore it  Measured my waste correctly before I bought it and it was still too big within the first few days of wear...

Bought in Large--had twins too!  Used one provided by hospital first week and then fit into belly bandit in a large one week Postpartum.  Now going on 2 1/2 weeks postpartum I'm going to need to order size down!  This thing really works!!

I had originally went to the belly bandit website for the sizing. It fit just like it was suppose to - snug but still able to be Velcro shut. Im so glad I bought it. It helped a lot with core support once I delivered.
Wanted to love this and use it but it's not true to size. (Runs small) and it bends weird and doesn't lay nicely at all. Complete disappoinment.

I like this belly band a lot and the fit is snug but perfect for what I was looking for.  I really think this helps a lot with the postpartum healing process too.  I started wearing it on occasion right after I got home from the hospital from having my son. Although I did not have a C-section it really helped to reduce the pain I had from cramping in the few weeks after delivery and of course holds in all that extra baby fat and swelling that is still going down after birth.  My only complaint it that the seam is really thick where the velcro attaches which makes it hard to wear discreetly underneath tighter clothes.

I started to wear it two weeks after my c-section until I was about 3 months postpartum.  It most certainly helped get me back in shape quicker than I think I would have on my own.  People couldn't believe how quickly I was back to my normal size!
Worked well! Now I need a smaller size!

My torso is a bit long, so this creates a bit of a muffin top effect. I guess if you're squeezing the fat it has to go somewhere, right? Anyhow, was using something similar from the hospital after my c- section, then stopped. Started having back pain, incision pain, and pain with stretch marks right under my belly button. This added the support I was needing to aid in my recovery. One week later, and my core muscles are definitely strengthening, my stretch marks are smaller, and I'm almost totally pain free. I wear the band as often as I can, even to sleep and work out. Wish I would've continually worn something post c- section to aid in healing!

I really wanted to try this post baby, but it was so awkward and uncomfortable I ended up returning.  It might work if you have a straighter build vs. hourglass.  I couldn't get it to close properly without either gapping or bunching.  I decided the money would be better spent toward some workout classes.

I really don't like this product! It's too short (I'm 5' 7" and it didn't cover much of my torso). It also is very hot! It's uncomfortable and gives you a cylindrical shape with ni curves. It also shows under clothing very easily. The fabric creases like it said it would, but in doing that, it makes you look like you have really bad back fat rolls! LOL

Expands soon, couldn't use after a month. I ordered small based on the instruction/ size chart and it become big after using less than a month. I am really disappointed with this product, my tummy still looks big and i couldn't wear the belt as it expanded and not tight enough. I would like to get a refund or replacement.

This thing is awful. It's not long enough for my long torso, so it either causes bulges of back fat above it, between it and my bra, or it fails to hold in the lower part of my belly. It rides up like crazy; it's incredibly difficult to close the velcro and have it aligned, and it has creased making it very obvious under clothing.

This worked great! I will be ordering again, if I get pregnant again. I wish I ordered in a smaller size. I was going back and forth between a medium and a small. I got a medium. I'm 5'5 and weighed 160 at the end of my pregnancy. The band was too big after a week postpartum and I switched to the Bellefit gurdle. The product is well made and as described.

I'm a size 6 pre-pregnancy and only gained weight in the belly. I thought a medium would fit according to the size chart but it did not fit after i gave birth, it only went around my post partum bellu half way. It's way too small.
This was way too small and uncomfortable after my c-section. I sent it back and continued wearing the wrap they gave me at the hospital.

So uncomfortable. If you actually have kids to chase around and breastfeed, you will hate this thing. Not to mention it doesn't breathe and is super hot (if you're in summer months or a warmer climate), wish I could return it.
Wish it felt a little more "secure" but does the job.  I wish it wasn't so expensive considering how quickly it became too big (yes I went by the suggestions in the measurement guide)

This sucks. I don't understand why they are so many positive reviews. It is over priced and once you buy it, you cannot return it so you are taking a chance with the tummy band.
It sucks because of the material. It's like plastic and it doesn't hold it's shape around your back and keeps crinkling. You constantly have to readjust. Additionally it's not wide enough tto give you hip and tummy support which you need postpartum and I am 5'3 feet,. I ordered a medium and it fits good.
Save your money and reuse the hospital provided bands or buy the "sweet sweat band." Works just as good.

Sizing worked perfectly as described. This was my first pregnancy so I have nothing to compare it to, but I am so glad I bought this and used it postpartum. I think it definitely played a large role in being able to return to my pre-pregnancy body. I was able to return to pre-pregnancy jeans less than a week from birth.
Was unable to use and unable to send back, which I was not aware of. If you have a c section, you will need the bamboo one.

I bought this for post partum and wore it the day after I gave birth. My stomach shrank really quickly so I soon outgrew this. It was ok the first few times I worke it but then it became too big and started bunching around my stomach. Worked well for a while.

Ordered size xs per sizing chart and it's too small for me 2 days post partum. Would like to exchange for small without having to buy another but because I bought it in march I cannot exchange or return it.
Ordered according to size chart, I couldn't close it until 2 week post partum. Didn't notice any significant difference with use.
Would not reccomend. I was constantly pulling up on this and it never really worked. I would stand up and the whole thing would be below my belly.
I realy do love it but i did recomand the smal and i received the medium and now i cant return it to get the smal

I was a size 18 pre pregnancy and ordered the XL. I ordered it a week after delivery and I have it as tight as it will go. I feel good wearing it and nicely supported. After wearing it all day I am ready to take it off at night. I wore a support band in the hospital, but it made my stomach so itchy. The belly bandit does not do this. I'm glad I bought the belly bandit, and I will be purchasing a size down to continue my recovery process.
Really helps keep things in check to work out and prevent further stretch marks.

I am rating based on looks alone because I did not have the opportunity to wear the product. I measured at 41 weeks pregnant and was given a size to buy. This was entirely too small. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the actual material of the product is nice.
Helps get uterus and hips back in shape
It's useless. It does not help reduce any fraction of inch of my belly after using it for 3 months. And it's very uncomfortable to wear.
used this with my first baby and again with my 2nd.  works wonders if you wear it!
I Love My Belly Band. I feel so much better after I wesr it around the home. It is very comfortable and flexible. I would recommend for anyone looking to help that baby belly shrink.

GREAT product. Everyone keeps saying that they can't believe I just had a baby.

I used mine the first day I had my baby in the hospital. It was hard to get closed, but by day 3 when I was leaving the hospital, it was the perfect fit. I'm 4 weeks postpartum now and still wear it. I think it really does help. There are so many gimicky products out there for post pregnancy, but this one really does help and really does work. Worth every penny and I will recommend this to all my friends.
Stiff and uncomfortable, very hot in the summer!

I had my baby 8 days ago via cesarean and this has been such a help! I feel held in and my belly has drastically reduced in size much quicker than with my first. I'm able to use my abdominal muscles more and don't have to worry about straining my incision. I highly recommend this!
Loved this and used it for the first 3 weeks, but then bought the bamboo version which is much softer and easier to wear all day long. Belly bandit has great products!

I measured myself before looking at their sizing chart. For 37" inch waist they recommend a size small so thats what I ordered.
After three days it was already too large to have lasting effects. The band definitely works and I started using after two weeks of delivery.

I like to exchange for an extra small as I love the product and sent seller an email to see if I can exchange for an extra small and waiting on their reply. Will update you once I hear from them.

Due to material band will crinkle. But doesnt affect results.
I was pumped to get this and look slimmer. It loses its shape fast. XL was too big, L isn't just right and medium is too small.

I had heard great things about the belly bandit, but this was such a bummer! It was WAY to small - I'm a size 4 - 6 waist 27 pre pregnancy and around currently while losing weight. I know you're supposed to cinch this, but you would need a tractor to get this thing to velcro together! Not sure who they are setting the small to fit.

This is a post pregnancy must have! Began using right after having a c-section. In the beginning, I had to use all my strength to get the velcrow to touch but within a week I lost three inches. This helps tremendously to compress the stomach and jump start your body to feeling somewhat normal again. Ended up using around the clock for about three weeks until moving to another product by the same maker as the Belly Bandit became to large (it didn't stretch out by any means; my body just completely changed).

I'm really bummed. I've only worn it a few times and the material seems to have pulled in the middle causing an hourglass shape. I'm a pretty tiny girl so I'm not sure how I could have caused it to do that.
Product runs small. Good quality, and works great.

I started using at about 3 weeks postpartum. I wanted to see what size I would need since I knew I would shrink in size pretty quickly, and that was fortunate because I probably would have needed to buy two different sizes of the Belly Bandits. I do have a bit of trouble sitting in it, so I only wear at night when I sleep. I've seen my tummy shrink a little bit so far! Will see how this works out but so far, I'm happy with it.

Do not waste your money on this one. Get the bamboo one instead. I am 127 lbs after I delivered 4 weeks ago with a 28" waste. I got the xsmall and it fits fine. However it folds so easy and crinkles. Feels so cheaply made. I got the bamboo one and it is so soft and smooth and MUCH more comfortable to wear. Save yourself the money and go straight for bamboo style.

Amazing. Used this for post partum to get my belly back. Went from 39 in to 31.5 in in 2 weeks. Would defin8tely recommend. Started with a large and got down to a Xtra small. Can't say enough to good things about it.

I love the first belly bandit that I got for right after the birth. I wore it every day and it was wonderful. I didn't have one after my first kid and it felt like my guts were gonna fall out of me every time I stood up. This time with the belly bandit it was much easier to stand up straight even right after birth. Also my uterus contracted back to normal size in RECORD speed- my midwife was impressed. My stomach also shrunk much faster and I am pleased with the results. Once I shrank down to the smallest the first BB would go, I decided to get the next size down (extra small). This was a mistake. Even though the small is now too large, it was time to give up and go for their corset. The extra small just rolls up on itself and causes me to look all lumpy from outside my clothes so I can't really wear it anywhere besides the house, and the way it scrunches up is uncomfortable.
Slightly large in circumference, and a tad short for a girl my height (5'10") but overall a quality product.
Shrunk my stomach in half in a few days
Worth every penny! Wore this for the first week after delivery of my first baby and saw huge results, also definitely helped support my back which was awesome.

After less than two weeks of using this as directed the band is constantly scrunching up in the middle and riding up. The scrunching is so bad that there are now permanent ridges in the middle of the band. I really wanted to like this and I think it was working well, but I don't know that I can continue using it when it is this uncomfortable due to the bunching.
Just rides up again and again, very uncomfortable to wear, gets wrinkles in it the first time you wear it  and they never go away. I hated this product, it didn't do anything for me. What a joke.
If you are thinking about a large, purchase a medium. The quality of the product is excellent.

I wanted to love his product so badly. I measured myself at 37 weeks and ordered it right away. The moment I was able to in the hospital, I put it on. Within two hours, it had folded over and scrunched up and would not go back to its proper position. I also got the kourtney kardashian version which worked out a little better. This version is not good for people with long torsos either. The kk model later about 2 weeks of 24/7 wear before it just folded too much. I looked slim in this while wearing it and almost bought into it too. Six weeks of round the clock wearing a belly bandit girdle and at 7 weeks, the pooch is right back where it was. These products are a hoax.

I had an emergency c-section and am thankful for this product! It not only helped my uterus shrink faster but it decreased the pain. I would just put it above the incision so it doesn't get infected (I originally wore a hospital band and it infecfed my incision). I definitely plan to use the band in my next pregnancy.
Must have for postpartum recovery!! I ordered 2 different sizes to keep wearing as my belly shrunk. Wore 24/7 starting day 1 after delivery. The extra support felt great too.

Love this product! Just be aware I gained 33 pounds with my pregnancy. I usually fit in a size small. It took about a week for my stomach to slim down and than I could put on the belly bandit. But I'm glad I didn't go up in size otherwise it would of been too big. Better to go smaller than larger

I would not recommend this at all. Instead, I'd recommend getting the leggings from this company. This band s extremely uncomfortable to wear, it was hard for me to bend over because it was so thick, and pushed up against my breasts when I sat down and when I breastfed my daughter. In the summer, definitely do not buy this, wayyyyyyyyyy too hot. for me, I felt like it did nothing and due to how uncomfortable it was, I rarely wore it, I purchased it at a baby fair and I think it cost about 50-60. This was the only thing I splurged on while pregnant. What a waste of money I could have spent on my baby.

It did get an annoying crease in the very middle of the band within two days of use. I'm a lean (135 lb before pregnancy, 160 at 40 weeks) and 5'8" with a long torso. However, the band is comfortable and easy to use. At three days postpartum I needed my husbands assistance in order to be able to fit in it. The next day I was able to put it on my self. It works like a charm, this was my second pregnancy and at 5 days postpartum I'm wearing my size 4 stretch jeans. I did not fit into my pre pregnancy clothes after the first child for about 6-8 weeks and I was 8 years younger then (late20's). Now I'm in my mid 30s and this is amazing to me. When I went out for a walk with my newborn my neighbors couldn't believe how great I looked. I don't wear it to sleep I'm happy with the results I'm getting.

This is very comfy to wear all day and all night.  Fit was great, especially at first.  But after about 5 days this folds and bunches and really doesn't seem to function as intended anymore.  That's very disappointing considering how $$$ it was and also considering I was hoping to wear this 5-6 weeks.  I'm not sure this will survive structurally for much more than a week.  And yes, I have the right size... yes, I'm a bit flubbery all the way around... but this product is intended to be used post-pregnancy so the target consumer will be all of these things!!  I expected better.
I was really excited about this product, but I was so grossed out when I noticed it had a brown stain on the inside of the wrap!
I have had hard time with the belly bandit. The S was kind of small and the M was big (I have both).
Comfortable to wear wish it was wider hope to see some results just got it last week
Waste of money, even the small size is big and didn't work for me. Save your money!!!!
I can't believe I went through my first pregnancy recovery without this!! It's a must.

I ordered 2 after having my first child and I don't feel like it helped at all in shrinking my belly. I follow the sizing guidelines and it fit fine. I'll admit it was a good support garment because you basically have no core after childbirth and it is probably really beneficial if you have a c section (I didn't). I was fortunate not have much of a belly after he was born. In fact I think I have more of one now and I'm not sure if it is because I didn't wear my Belky Bandit for the recommended amount of time. I was able to tolerate it for 3 weeks day and night, not the 6 they say produces the best results. It is stiff and does not move with your body. It is difficult to wear under your clothes and does not stay in place. It requires constant readjusting. The worst was at night when it would slide up on my abdomen and squash my sore, milk-engorged boobs. My biggest complaint is it is not machine washable and if anyone else is like me it would get soaked during my delightful postpartum hormone sweats. Not fun!

I bought a LG initially and have ordered a M now - I really am a fan of these! Received on time and as expected. I would recommend. I will mention that they do bend toward the top and bottom but I don't think they'd be as comfortable if they didn't.

Great for the first month post partum. Its easy to put on and take off. It is very comfortable and is not to tight that it would make you feel like you are compressed inside of it, but tight enough to hold everything in place. Of course after a few weeks, you might want to go tighter or use a waist trainer or something but post partum this one is great.
I had a size large from belly bandit.com and this size medium was wayyyy smaller than expected. Its smaller than the one from the webite

My wife loved it. It was very comfortable and did exactly what she wanted it to. It help get her baby weight off much faster. She said that she was able to get back in her per - pregnancy jean in a week and a half. With our first baby she wasn't able to get back into her old pants for a long time after.
We ended up having to buy a smaller size after the first week because she was dropping the weight and hip size so quickly that the first one we got was too small. Right after our baby was born she could barely get the larger size on, after the week and a half she was about half way through the smaller sized one.

Extremely dissapointed. I started wearing this product immediately post-pardum. First off, it fit but a couple days later once my belly started shrinking, it became to large. Also, it was extremely uncomfortable. Every time I bent over, you could hear the loud crinkling of the Velcro...embarrassing. Plus, it was visible through all of my clothing and made my stomach look lumpy. It was also difficult to put on correctly. Overall it was a waste of money because after a month I became frustrated and quit wearing it.

I actually bought mine at babies r us so I got to try mine on before I bought it (I also tried on the babies r us brand but the belly bandit had way more coverage). For sizing, I went by shirt size pre-pregnancy. I wore a large so I bought a medium so it would be a tight fit (for better results). I went on a (protein) diet and I have only been wearing it for a little over a month and I already need a smaller size. It works really well, just wish I could trade it in for a smaller size instead of buying a new one.
I always wear a small, wore a small all throughout my pregnancy, this was tiny, had to return
Really uncomfortable and bulky. The Velcro is annoying to mess with.

Started with a medium right after I delivered my baby and about 3 weeks later I ordered the small that I can now wear for the next couple weeks. I was 150 when I got pregnant and gained 30 pounds and now I am 155 and the belly bandit really helped. I still have a little pooch that will only go away with diet and exercise.
A must have for every women who has recently given birth!  Nothing short of a life saver!!!
I am disappointed by the product. The way it sits you can see it under clothes and I don't like the way it fits. I was really hoping I was going to love it.
Way too small and there was no option to change my size. I was not happy about that. I will be returning this item.
It pulls up in the back. And it can get hot
So nice to use recovering from a c-section! Nice support

Not comfortable at all
Not happy
It's not smooth under clothes makes me lol bulkier
I bought it tried loving it but it just doesn't work too well. It's very rough and shifts up after a long time wear. It did absolutely nothing for me.

I have diastasis recti and this helps me feel more stable and put together when I'm working out. However it is super hard to put on myself and would be better if there were two separate pieces that came across. It gets bunched easily when I try to Velcro it myself but it is fine if my husband helps. It does not conform well to my body though and I get painful red lines at my waistline after wearing it for an hour or so. I would also like it a lot more if it were longer and covered my torso completely.
It cuts into my back and it doesn't fit right. I can't wear it.

I was not able to use right after birth but I was able to use it by the next day. It helped significantly with the pain associated with post partem contractions while nursing. I made sure to have it on before nursing so I would be in less pain. I didn't have this device with my first two and I wish I would have! It was not comfortable, but it did the job I needed it to do.

This product really helps with support after giving birth. It also helps to smooth and flatten the appearance of your stomach. I'm not sure about long term results because I've only been wearing for about 1.5 weeks. My only complaint is the fact that you can see the place where the Velcro crosses over in the front which you can then see underneath clothes.
Have had it on for a week and already notice my belly going down in size.
Way too small and very stiff and uncomfortable.  Couldn't wait to take it off the first time I wore it. Waste of money.

I love these things. I used one for about 6 weeks after delivering my youngest naturally and it really helped with my diastisis recti that never fully healed after my first. I only wore it around the house because it did show under clothes but I didn't leave the house much those first few weeks anyway. He just turned a year and the 'mama bump' that I sported after my oldest (8) is actually gone and I think my stomach *almost* looks like I never had kids. I recommend it to all the mamas I know.

I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

Worked great for 2 days... now it's too big haha. Which I guess isn't a bad thing. I got a medium. Prepregnancy I was 120lbs. I weighed 175 at the end, and am just now 6 weeks post partum, 145lbs. The medium is too large now, it is snug tightened all the way, but not tight enough. I will be ordering a small in the near future!

It rolls up from the hips, is difficult to put on by myself and is not hidden under clothing. I think you could probably get the same benefits from a cheaper version.
This being my first baby, I can't speak to if it helps more or not- I do like the support it provided for my back and feeling held together
I ordered an XL and it fit for a week. Belly bandit has a trade in program but I won't be using it. After spending $50 I don't plan on spending more to size down when I followed the size chart

Since I am currently expecting I am not able to use the product yet but wanted to give an overall feel for the product. Seems well constructed but very stiff. Expected the product to have a little give to it to make it more comfortable for using right after childbirth.

I wore this for 3 days after I had the baby and immediately the fabric would fold over in the back. It was also too big to wear after the first week so now I have to buy another band to keep wearing. It was definitely not worth the $50 I paid for it.

I had the size medium from my previous pregnancy and decided to get a small as well this time. After two days I was able to fit into the small and my stomach is almost back to its regular size! It's recommended to wear this for 6 weeks which I do plan to do because it gives great support!
Great product!  Wish someone would have told me about it immediately after having my babies, not 2 + years later!

I started wearing this the day after delivery. This is my first pregnancy so I am not sure if it helped or not but it made me feel good that I was being proactive so quickly after delivery. It isn't comfortable enough to wear constantly but I found taking it off to nurse and sleep gave me enough break to keep it on the rest of the time. I am 4 weeks post delivery and now only wear it a few hours a day. I typically wore an XS-S clothing size pre pregnancy and in maternity clothes and the XS fits well.
Not worth the money. Shows from underneath your clothes and slides up. Better off with a corset.
Soon as I gave birth, I put this on. Comfortable and helps with swelling
Fits as described. I'm not sure how well it works because it wasn't comfortable enough or discreet enough to wear outside the house.
I love the postpartum support this offers - it is great. I'm not sure how much it helped my belly shrink but the support was good only wish this was cheaper.

Reviews are right.. way too small and I don't know how I could even wear this all day. Material is SO rigid and has no give which I understand why, but I wish there was some elasticity in it. Will be returning this item

I found that the Belly Bandit was too stiff to be able to sit down while wearing.  I breast feed my little one and couldn't keep it on while feeding.  It's too much work taking it on and off with the frequency of sitting.  It does provide support when standing but couldn't make it work for me.  The return policy isn't great.  I bought it ahead of time and by the time I got to try it, I was unable to return it.  I wouldn't recommend this product.

I've really loved my belly bandit! I'm four weeks post partum and my stomach has come back together nicely. I followed the size chart on the Belly Bandit website, and I'm glad I did! I almost ordered a medium because I was borderline small/medium when I initially measured, but I went a size down. Good thing! And actually, I need an even smaller size (I'm going to borrow my friend's extra small). I worked out my entire pregnancy, and went back to the gym after two weeks so I think my body shrunk quicker than most, so those results may not be totally typical. I'd definitely say go a size down if you're in between sizes, you want it to be tight! My friend said her husband had to help her get it on the first few days. Having the support around your abdomen and back is really nice when your belly is "squishy" after birth.
I followed the size chart but could have gone a size smaller so that I would have more use of the correct size.

Bought this after reading blogs about binders. It works great! The website sizing guide said I was an XS, glad I didn't follow that advice! Everyday it fits a little better as my belly shrinks. I try and wear it all day and night. Worth the investment.
Ordered based on the measurements on their website and it was way too small.
I am pregnancy size xxs 00 petite and the xs/'s stretched out too much after less than two weeks so it was not worth what I paid.
Very uncomfortable; hot and sweaty under clothing, and bunches uncomfirtably when you sit down.
I like the product, the only thing is that it doesn't stay in its place and you have to accommodate it trough the day...
It is to big. Should have gotten smaller size.

I have orders a few things that are belly bandit and been very happy, love the mother tucker tank and the leggings!!!  But I do not At all recommend buying the original belly bandit. I was hopeful it would give a little more compression and help with my stomach after having baby #2 but it bunches all over the place, itches like crazy and hurts my csection incision... It's also too large and I totally used the measuring guide!! I don't think this bad boy works and there's no way I'd be able to wear it discreetly in public. Would love to be able to return it since after wearing a handful of times know that it was a complete waste of money.
Helped quickly bring my belly back to normal after giving birth!

I was very disappointed in this product. I had originally purchased the medium Belly Bandit for after my baby was born and loved it. After 3 weeks it was too big so I decided to go ahead and invested in the small size because the first one was so great. When I received the small Belly Bandit I was disappointed to find that the quality of it was not as high as the first one I had purchased. It was made out of a much thinner material and was not as comfortable. The tag was also not printed on the band itself like the first one and was constantly getting in the way of velcro the band.  Wish I had not wasted my money on this one.
So happy to have this after my first baby to help me feel more like me again!
At first I was worried the size didn't fit but after 2 days my tummy went down a bit and I was able to get it on. I love it
It is perfect for tucking that "extra skin" from having a child.
Am returning this due to the size being way too small.

Way to small. I did measurements before I had my daughter, just as they said too. Tried to wear it and it's not close to fitting. I wanted to return for a different one but apparently you can't return this. I wouldn't order until after baby of you may never use it!
Fits true to size and really helps. Comfortable to Sir in.
Fit much smaller than expected and have to retur

It didn't fit the first few days after baby came,  but having a c-section it was too painful to attempt to wear anyway. I started wearing it at home after I was released from the hospital but it was very hard to sit in because its so stiff. I would get up and try to walk around for 15 minutes 4 times a day (for a faster recovery) and I would wear it during that time. I do think it helped me get small faster, I stopped wearing it after 2 weeks because I was almost back to my normal size (except a remaining 10 pounds I will have to lose with good old diet and exercise) All in all I think it did what it claims to do!

I liked this but it was way bigger than I thought!  It only fit for about 2 days.  I do however, feel like it worked.  It also helped me feel less like a bowl of jello, so I was active far sooner than I would have been without it.
It's a really good band in my opinion, I was a little worried about the size but it fit perfectly. It feels comfortable even when I am breastfeeding my baby it feels right.

It's a little tight to put on, but that's the purpose. It's actually quite comfortable too. You will be able to see it under tight-fitting clothes, but that doesn't bother me. It helps with the loose feeling after birth.
The Belly Bandit fit's great but when you apply the Velcro it ends up sticking crooked especially when trying to make it tight.
This thing is amazing!  I had my second child a week ago and my belly is already fitting into my skinny jeans thar were tight before I got pregnant!

LOVE my Belly Bandit! Used it immediately after my c-section and it was a life saver! Helped tremendously with supporting my torso and back. AND my waist was back down to normal size within 2 weeks! Fits true to size chart. Great quality and very comfortable!

First day I wore it I was 3 days post partum, it was barley closing. In less than.a week it was too big. It would close & be loose. The sizing is very different. Going to purchase a medium but afraid it might be too small. I wear an 18 in pants but my waist is small. A large lasted me 3 days -_-

It did not work for me. My belly is mush, and I'm so sad I wasted $50 on this. It might work for others, but it did not help me. Since I spent the money I just wear it around the house, but still no difference at all.

This was a great belly band. It really helped me a lot after I gave birth. It felt like it helped to hold me together. It's nice a wide, so it gives lots of support. It never irritated my skin. Of course, wrapping a band around your stomach isn't the most comfortable thing in the world, but after birth, it was more comfortable to wear this than to not.

I got the smallest size possible and it was to big after a week of wearing it. But I just sewed it. It helped me have a flat tummy after just 2 weeks post TWINS! I highly recommend it to everyone that asks me how I got my flat stomach so fast.
Didn't fit right away, but now I can make it fit. Have only been wearing it a day but hopeful it'll help me get back down to size!

Thought I would be a medium but based off other reviews I read I got a small. Glad I did. Two days post partem and the small will overlap by about 4 inches with 4 inches to go. I felt a difference immediately in my back. My mid section has felt a little "gumby-ish" since giving birth and the belly bandit has given me a lot of support back. Glad I purchased.
Seemed to do what it said it would do!

Belly bandits are a must have to help your waist shrink back to its pre-baby position. This band is very comfortable and easy to care for. My only complaint is that I needed a smaller size after a couple weeks and they are expensive
Stretches out quite a bit so if u think it's too small give it a shot anyway.
This is way smaller than their site directs. Also is very uncomfortable. Did not use at all postpartum - waste of money.

I bought this for post partum purposes. Over all,I would not recommend this product.  The band's material is stiff and folds/buckles in areas when being worn, which looks terrible under clothes. Also, I'm long waists and it does not cover my entire stomach.  It's cheaply made.  You'd be better off getting spambot an simply wrapping an ace bandage.arubd your waste.
Really helped with post partum healing. Not always the most comfortable on the skin, so I wore it on the outside of shirt and it was perfect
The website suggested a large based on my measurements but it was too big. Once I returned it and got the medium the sizing was spot on.
Hard to figure right size. Material feels rough on skin. Bought mine and returned it.

It does its job decently to shrink your belly first weeks postpartum, but I gave it 2/5 stars because it made my belly sooo itchy that after several weeks of wearing it I started wear it only for couple hours a day, and now at 5 weeks postpartum I don't even wanna wear it because of how uncomfortable it is. Also it bends really bad so it becomes really uncomfortable to move around. I believe  for $50 the material this belt is made of should be of better quality.

I would have given zero stars. It didn't fit worth a lick and didn't have instructions in English (not that it's not self explanatory) or in Spanish! It didn't even fit around my super skinny tween niece - so how is it going to fit a new mama who just had a big baby?!? This product was not at all what was described and I ended up returning it ASAP!
I love this thing.  It really helped me and made me feel comfortable after my C-section.  It was a little tender in the early going but over all this product was great.

I bought this item in anticipation to giving birth to my third child. I had read a lot of the reviews and had heard great things about this brand in particular . I was very excited to use it and hopefully see results. I have been using it for three weeks now starting immediately after birth and I'm extremely disappointed with it. Within the first week of wear it bunched up in back and has never been the same to the point where the crease is A.so bent out of shape it is visible through clothing B. Painfully pushing into my back. At this point it is so uncomfortable I cannot wear it anymore and because i bought it before i gave birth it is over the thirty day return limit so that was basically 50$ down the drain!! Huge Huge disappointment!!
Helped me get back into fighting form in no time... was helpful to feel strong again in taking care of baby.

I had to return it.  I know some people love it - and it may be recommended for c-section but can I make a suggestion?

Get one for free from the hospital.

I had a c-section and got a "hospital grade" one that is more stretchy but gives great support. I would ask for two sizes, one bigger one for when you're still there and a smaller one when your stomach gets smaller.

Don't waste $50 - buy some educational toys or books instead
I had a c section. This was just an awkward fit and sort of wrinkled and was hard to get on there straight and tight.
Went down a size in a couple days, kinda exciting and frustrating at the same time. I would need to buy 3-4 of these in each different size to use postpartum. I would size down. Had great support.

I just got this today and I already love it. I was using a stretchy band, but I feel the bandit offers more support and you can adjust it when your stomach gets smaller.  You can see it under clothes, but that's not an issue for me since I'm a SAHM. The other band cut into me so you could see the fat bulge, so I couldn't wear that one under clothes either.
My only issue with the bandit is the sizing. I went to their website and used the size calculator. It told me to get a medium but I only have an inch and a half left before the band is too big. I should have gotten a small.

This is great if you wear a second compression garment underneath it because it has a tendency to roll. It definitely served it's purpose but I've also bought a corset type waist cincher because I got a small and it's as tight as it goes, also it's not very long, so it's not compressing as much as I'd like. I'm definitely glad I got it though!

It definitely helped suck things in after my c-section. Not sure if it made things go down faster this time (second baby) but it was definitely worth the try. It did feel nice because it felt like it kept my stomach from moving which is not always the greatest feeling the first 6 weeks after surgery. My only complaint is it does bunch up a lot so you can't wear it under your clothing inconspicuously.

At first when I tried this on I thought it was going to offer great support, but within a few hours it was creasing and rolling up when I sat down. It didn't stay in place at all. It did seem to support my back when getting in and out of bed the first few days, but it was extremely annoying to have to adjust it every time I moved positions.

Came on time and as promised. I'd say that this is true to the sizing guide so make sure to follow that. Only downside is that it's sort of difficult to put on by yourself. That said, I'd still buy it twice over. I had a csection and the binding helped support me.
I wish I would have paid more for the bamboo belly bandit. This one is extremely uncomfortable and itchy. I couldn't keep it on for more than an hour at a time or I would break out in a rash.
I was concerned about fit bc I have a long torso. It did fit as far as that goes. I don't think it helped my belly pp. Def not worth the price
Go down a size if you're near the lower end of the size range for your size. I was within two inches of the low end and within one day I was at the end of the Velcro.
Great product, but stretches out easily. Wish I would have sized down for what was recomended.
Good for after having a baby. Slim up and tighten that belly back into place.
The product is ok just that it folds a lot at the waist and back.

Felt like it didn't fit very well. Bought the medium and I'm not exactly a small lady, but it was still too big after having my baby. I ended up using it for some back support, but that was about it. Overall just didn't fit well.
It was too small but i was sent the wrong size so now just waiting for my new one ...but loved the way it felt.
I just wish there was more velcro so you could make it very tight.
Bunches up more than the bamboo version. Helps with back support and compression though...not to mention helping me feel less flabby and more like myself postpartum.
Fit perfectly. I found that it fits better under my pants. It doesn't move or ride up when underneath.
I like the concept but it didn't work as well as I hoped. It would ride a up, I might have gotten it too big though.
Awful! Hard, stiff and apparently you need to be 6 foot tall for this to fit. I'm 5'5 and this thing legit goes past my boobs. Can't even wear it.

I used this with my first pregnancy and it really works. It can bunch up at times and be uncomfortable after wearing for awhile but the results are worth it! Because there isn't much Velcro you will end up having to buy a smaller size which can get costly. I think I may buy Velcro to sew on myself to try and make this one last!
Too big and I can't exchange it.  Material is too stiff for my liking.

Purchased a medium per belly bandit website specs. The band fit for one week postpartum and then was was too small and velcro would not catch tight enough. I could have purchased several different sizes of another product for the price of one of these. Save your money and buy something else.

I wore the shrinxx first over the cpanty and the velco wore out so I decided to try the belly bandit. At a local store they had the Belly Bandit made out of the organic material only in an extra small. I tried the extra small and I could barely get it velcroed so I felt like I needed to get a small, the small is almost too big which is frustrating. I decided to save a few dollars and order the original.  I do wish I would have ordered the organic it was much softer than the Belly Bandit original. Also after only wearing it for one week the band has folded in half in the back and on the side which is quite annoying. I do think the product works so I rated it four stars however I am NOT impressed with the quality of the original Belly Bandit.

I purchased before delivery according to the suggested sizing calculator on the website. A couple of days after delivery, it was hard to put on and seemed too small but a week later seemed like it fit just right. Fortunately I haven't had to use much due to breastfeeding so I don't have a long term review.
Product as described and looks like it will be helpful once I've given birth.

I had ordered a medium through Target and it was too big. I'm 5'4" and pear shaped, 137 lbs pre pregnancy. I ordered the small and put it on lying down and sucking it in, with my husband's help. I'm giving this 2 stars because it folds up at the bottom and folds in at the waist and the front. It does not move well with you, you either have to be lying down straight or sit up straight in order for it not to fold. best advice is to wear it backwards. I wear this over a cotton tank top to avoid sweat. I recommend not buying this and searching for a better postpartum wrap.

I really like this product- seems to have worked pretty well for me. Seems like it fits a little big, though. I was a size 6 before getting pregnant with twins. I bought a medium 3 days after the babies were born, and it was too big. I had to order a small instead. (Don't worry- they won't take items like this back for sanitary reasons, but they did work with us about receiving a product we were in satisfied with).
Fits much better than the Medela band that I used after a previous pregnancy. Easy to use and can feel a noticeable difference in lower back support.
Too small! Buyer beware when sizing they do not let you exchange!!!
HATE IT. Don't waste your money on this. It bunches up horribly.
Thank fo giving me my tight tummy back after baby! Wish it was more convenient to wear but boy does it work!

My measurements had me between a medium and a small, so I opted for the small (thinking positively). After delivery, I could velcro it about halfway already. On day 3 I was able to velcro all the way - with no more room to tighten. I will have to get a smaller size (honestly, I'm not complaining - this is a good problem to have and I know it) - so the sizing can be tricky.
However, it feels AWESOME. It could cough and laugh more confidently and I just felt like I wasn't fall all over the place. I'm hoping the smaller size will help me get back to pre-pregnancy shape faster...but even if it doesn't, this just FEELS good after 9 months of stretching.

Bigger than I expected as far as the support is great especially after c section. It supported my back and the flappy extra fat from pregnancy hanging from the incision. I was able to walk and take care of my 15 month old toddler and a newborn. My healing is  definitely a lot better than my first c section with this belly bandit support.
Was not what my wife was anticipating. Did not live up to other more superior products.  Wife wore once and put it back in its box.
I found it too big I feel there is no compression and the bel row you can see under your shirt.. To thick where it over laps

Product worked well to bring my stomach muscles together after giving birth. I couldn't wear it all the time bc it was long and would hinder breastfeeding. It also would cause my milk to let down if I sat too slumped in it. All in all, worth getting but has some issues.
This is a MUST have post baby!  Helps hold everything tight so it helps with comfort and pain. It helped me get back to pre-baby belly in two months.

Beware of this product as with any binders it can increase your incidence of prolapse. This really helped with my c section, when I had it on I didn't feel as much pain moving. I would use it again but I will be careful as my friend ended up with some pelvic prolapse after using one which (according to my OB) can be brought on by these, not worth it at all.

I was a medium before I got pregnant and I thought a medium Belly Bandit would work. I love it and I think it's helped me but I wish I'd gotten the small so it would be more snug for longer. Great quality though!
Folds constantly and is uncomfortable. Only works first couple of days before it starts to fold on the sides.

While this was completely uncomfortable with the first pregnancy I had, and I didn't wear it much at all, it helped me SO much with my second.  I was able to lose so much more in inches in the weeks right after birth and I had diastasis recti, so it also helped with the discomfort and side affects of that.  The fit is a bit small, but obviously as you shrink back down, the velcro can be pulled in more, so it will fit you as you need it to.  While I agree that you can see it under your clothes, it might not be the most comfortable thing, etc.  BUT this will help you size down quicker, will help your uterus to shrink back up & in and will help you with diastasis recti.  It is WELL worth the money and I would buy it again if I was ever to have another.
I used the sizing chart from the belly bandit website. The band was still too small. It's been 7 days since I've given birth and the band still doesn't fit. Sorely disappointed

I am 5'6 and 136 pre-pregnancy weight. I gained 30 pounds while pregnant and 10 days postpartum I have lost 18 pounds. The size small I ordered fits me and there is room to tighten the velcro as I loose more weight in the coming weeks. Not sure if this band will help tighten my stomach or just help me hold it in for a while. It is easy to see under a thin shirt or tank so I think a cardigan or second layer will be needed in order to wear it out in public

I bought this just after having my 8th baby. I wore it for three days and it seemed to be making a big difference, however, I developed a terrible rash with large, itchy red welps around my entire waist. I stopped wearing it and it has taken 5 days for the rash and itchiness to go away. It is made with 75%polyester, 25%lycra, so I'm not sure what my skin reacted to, but im not able to wear it and can't return it, so, for me, this was a complete waste of money.

I bought this when I was 39 weeks pregnant & it fit as needed after my c section. I don't wear it around the clock because it's kind of uncomfortable for me to sit in (I'm 5'3"). It keeps everything tight and is doing what I wanted it to do!!
Horrible, i guess you have to be a certain shape in order tonwear this, but its suppose to fit after pregnancy hmmm?
Only issue is that it creases which can be an annoyance.
Great post baby shaper. The small fit great and I highly recommend!

I originally bought the more expensive softer version of this for after my c-section. That was a good purchase for when I was wearing it during the day because it was more comfortable. As  recovered, I have transitioned to only sleeping in my belly bandit and for that purpose the version here has been great. I would love to see Belly Bandit create a product that is adjustable as you lose weight, as now I own a medium, small, and x-small.

This would be a great product if I was standing a majority of the time. It held everything in and you could visibly tell if I had been wearing it during the day or not (I would pooch out more if I hadn't been wearing it for a while).

As a brand new mom, however, I did everything I could to stay off my feet. When sitting, the Belly Bandit would get pushed up and off my stomach, to mash painfully into my (tender) breasts. I used it daily for a week (starting two weeks postpartum), off and on for another two weeks, then almost never after that. Now, 7 weeks postpartum, I look pretty much the same as I did before I started wearing it. I might have had better long-term results if I had been able to wear it until I could start working out again, but it was just too uncomfortable to sit in.

There's really no curve to this product, nor anything to keep it from riding up. Next time I'll be looking into something that goes between the legs like the Bellefit.

I am currently 2.5 weeks postpartum, and I feel that the belly bandit has been very helpful at getting my pre-pregnancy stomach back.  I started wearing it the second day after my daughter was born, and I usually wear it both day and night.  My husband and family have also noticed how well it seems to be doing.  I gave it 4 stars because like other reviews said, it does not lay flat and can be seen under certain outfits.  I'll usually still wear it anyway, because depending on if I suck it in or wear a looser shirt, it isn't that noticeable.  I would definitely use this product again with another pregnancy, and will continue to wear it with this one.

UPDATE: I have come to notice that if the product has become loose after wearing it a while, you can take it off for a few hours and it will tighten back up.

best purchase ive ever made, i started wearing it the day after i had my son and my belly definitly went down alot, it also gave me a lot of back support. if i was having more kids i would def buy it again, i always recommend to my friends
Fitted as expected and shipping was on schedule ! Loved the deal.
I like the product. Kind of hard to get used to at first. According to the size chart I needed a medium, but actually needed a small.
Love it! It fits well and is very comfortable!

This is a must have for postpartum belly support. Wow! This was my fourth baby and first time using one of these. I really noticed it a difference when I took it off. My back and belly felt wobbly and unsupported. My stomach shrunk down MUCH faster than it did with my 3rd babe. Cons? I live in the desert and it's way hot. Now that it is in the 90s, I can't hardly stand to wear it. Luckily, I am not needing it much longer. Fabric is not so comfy - I don't know what it's made out of but I think next to bare skin it would feel scratchy? My friend let me borrow her bamboo belly bandit and it felt so much more comfy. If I did this again, I would fork out the extra $ and get the bamboo. But it is a good product.

I guess I thought this would fit like the belly band they gave me in the hospital post-hysterectomy, which was very soft-textures and super stretchy and very comfortable to have on all day and night. This one is nothing like that. It's a gritty scratchy rough fabric, very rigid in the shape, way wider than other bands and super uncomfortable to wear unless you're standing up tall. I'm returning it.
It's too large and now I am stuck with it :( waste of money
Great product!  It was delivered on time.  I would recommend it.
Fit great. Helped slim my stomach after having a baby.
Does it work? I want to believe it helped post baby.
Larger than I anticipated but I didn't follow fitting directions. Just ordered xl because I wear xl in almost everything.

There are way better things out there for post partum. It doesn't cover your entire abdominal area, and I'm 5'2"!
I recommend a latex corset, a long one, for post partum. Try Ann Chery. ;)

Very helpful after having a baby!  It made me feel more confident walking around post baby, after having an unplanned c-section.  I also had a fractured rib, which helped with recovery.  Worth the buy!
Slightly uncomfortable when seated but so supportive otherwise that it's worth it.

I had an emergency c section & I wore it 6 days after it.
It's thick,rides up,bends & made creases that just won't go away wen when I wash it & try to iron it! I don't know if it did my body any good because I ordered a medium (according to their measurements) & it's just soo big! So I'm really disapponted..Im now wearing a regular victoria secret waist cruncher & I feel it's tucking and applying much more pressure than the bandit. Maybe if I got the small I would have wrote a diffrent review.
Comfortable fit, some results. I think I bought this too late. Best result likely right after delivery.

I out grew this very quickly!  I even went by the size chart on the website!  As other reviews state it creases in the back & makes extra rolls on top of the band.  Can not wear it under any form fitting clothes because of the crease/gold it makes.  I was so looking forward to using it too
semi-rigid and uncomfortable to wear. It kept riding up and bunching up so it didn't stay where I needed it to. Didn't wear it much because of this.
I like this product, but not as much as the Shrinkx band I also purchased. This band is flexible, but not comfortable enough to wear while sitting. I do believe it has helped shrink my belly though.
I think there needs to be a petite version. This reached far too high on my chest and if I fastened it lower I could not sit.
I guess I ordered bigger size, but it' OK..I like it - it holds OK)
I bought this for my daughter after she had a c-section and it is helping her shrink back into her clothes quickly.  She loves it!
The size small only lasted a week and I had to order the extra small. This product has been amazing and really helped sheink my waist after baby! I was back in my pre preggo jeans in under 2weeks.
I measured it exactly as the directions explained and it's way too big . Don't know if I an return it. If it fit , I'd like it  but now I'm just out of $50+ .
Did not do anything for me ... But maybe for somebody else..

This is my third belly band and is by far the worst! I loved the other two brands I've gotten, but this one was soooo itchy and miserable to be in I took it off every chance I got! The best one to get is the bamboo belly bandit. Do not waste your money on this one, unless you enjoy scratching yourself all day!

I ordered this cincher to help with post partum recovery- really just to help support my organs while my abs regained strength. I have the cheaper Medela version of this, too, and it worked much better. The both move around a bit, but the Belly Bandit was very stiff and wide, so that if I adjusted it to fit my hips and belly it would extend halfway up my ribs and have a significant gap around my waist. It was a little like wearing a cardboard tube. I returned it. For later recovery Leonisa cinchers and post partum panties worked really well, and are shaped like women's bodies, rather than tubes.

The sizing estimate on Belly Bandit's website was correct. I should have taken their advice, but I felt so much larger I got the size up and kinda regretted it. My friends that needed c-sections swear by this product, I got one just in case. Even though I got the larger size I would recommend it. My belly was back to normal in about 3 weeks, maybe that's because I am already a larger person but I'm happy about it.Belly Bandit Original Postpartum Belly Wrap

Not sure why this thing got such great reviews...bought it one month post-pardum and couldn't wear it. Too stiff and folded when I sat down or bent over ... showed through clothes... so uncomfortable...very warm to wear ...terrible product!

Works well for post c-section belly. Helps me feel like everything is in the right place. Received a lot of compliments on how I looked great post pregnancy all thanks to the help of the belly bandit.

I would like to have given this 5 stars, but it is definitely visible under clothing and will roll if you don't immediately go back to a size 2 post-partum  However, I still love it because it made me feel whole again after giving birth, if that makes sense. It makes walking around in the hours and days after birth so much more comfortable, and definitely helped me feel like I recovered a little more quickly than I would have without it. It also offers a small measure of back support which is always welcome.

This is great waist band. Make sure to check your size with chart. I followed the instructions and I got the right size. If you are stuck between sizes I would go with the smaller one. The plan is to reduce your waist size and it will eventually fit well.
I purchased this for my daughter and she loved it!. After 2 weeks she had to order a second one in a smaller size. Great product!

I bought this for my wife and she recently gave birth to our son.  She says that she likes the way that this feels, especially when she gets up out of a chair, or out of bed.  She tells me that it helps to make everything feel compressed and in tact.  The only reason that my wife rated it as 4 stars is that she says that she wishes that the material was more breathable since she's wearing it so often.  She also says that the velcro area is a bit stiff, so when she sits, it tends to ride up a bit.  Overall though, she says that she would definitely buy it again if she needed to for a future pregnancy.
Follow the sizing on belly bandit website. Worked perfectly for me.
I give it a 3 for style and price.  Really runs small.  So if you are a true small you will be ok if you purchase  a large.  It was a nice gift for a friend.
Perfect!! I LOVE it!!  Just remember that it runs small in size!!

The product is ok. You're better off getting the 18 piece version, or none at all, because I got multiple red, green and yellow markers. The yellows hardly show. The "tattoo remover" wipes are literally moist towelettes you get at restaurants. The most impressive part of the pack is the sealant, which is essentially watered-down glue. You're better off with Sharpies or other thin permanent marker (That doesn't run through the creases of your skin, mind you), Elmer's glue, water, and rubbing alcohol. Things you probably already have.

If you DO decided to buy this kit, I suggest a thin layer of baby powder slightly after applying the glue. This SOMETIMES keeps the sealant from collecting lint.

Sorry...but I hate them.  They are very small for writing, and since I attach them to my keychain, the round plastic hole for the chain to go through broke in one day!  (My other pens never broke, thicker plastic.)  If you just need a tiny pen and not using it for hanging it would be ok.  I won't buy these again since I have found the Pentel pens I want on Amazon. I'll have to agree with the reviewer that said the pen cap pulls off too easily if used in a keychain fashion, as described and intended, however I was looking for a very small pen to keep in my pocket, and it works very well for that. I unscrew the little keychain attachment, and the lid stays on in my pocket so I'm always ready to write in a notebook I carry; I frequently have a better pen, but not always. This one fits your hand pretty well if you remove the cap and place it at the but of the pen, otherwise it's a little too stubby. The product could certainly be improved by making the cap fit a little tighter, but it works well for what I wanted.

Honestly, if I had known the cap would fall or pull off so easily, I never would have purchased this product. I should have looked for push button or twist pens instead. These pens are small, fit well on a keychain, and writes okay, but I almost lost the cap(s) quite a few times. Due to the price point, it's not worth the time returning, but I won't buy again.

its kinda to big and honestly its not hard enough to stay put and to hard to sleep with to might work for some people it just did not work  for me

These sponge brushes make blending my facial makeup a BREEZE!  Every time I need to do a heavy contour, I reach for these brushes rather than my beauty blender.  I find this product easier to manipulate.  They are sturdy and well built, and everything arrived intact.

The makeup brush cleaner is also very very useful.  I was easy to see when a brush was truly clean due to the residual makeup being very visible against the purple silicon.

This bundle is a great value for the price and I would definitely recommend this product if you frequently contour or blend your facial makeup!

Only one of these sponges I was satisfied with and that was the teardrop; the other two seemed a bit flimsy.  When I used the cleaning item that came with the sponges, it tore through the sponges so I am no longer able to use them.  Not very satisfied with this product; wish it was of better quality.

I love these. They are really great, they last pretty long and stay even when you eat and drink. They don't leave any marks or anything once you've finished applying it and done it right. My favorite color is lovely peach if you just want something light but sexy red is also pretty nice if you want a dark red color. Just don't apply it to dry and flaky lips.

This was a pretty fun product and slightly harder to use than regular lip gloss. I had Fun experimenting and applying it, I just had to make sure to get it off my teeth wen I was done. However since I did get it close to my lip color I had to apply it twice to notice a difference and use some pretty thick coats to cover up my lip well. Its a good lip tint and my lips look great but still had to put on clear chapstick since it kinda dried up my lips. Would buy again :)

What I was left with was no visible difference in color whats so ever. I was pretty disappointed and this ended up in the trash.
I would give no stars if possible.  Extremely messy and difficult to apply.  It is very sticky and getting an even application is next to impossible. I threw it away.

I bought two different colors of these. I am that girl that HATES wearing stuff on my lips and reapplying throughout the day. These are great! I use a small lip brush to apply that I bought cheap from CVS. Make sure your lips are mosturized before using. Apply it slowly covering lips and don't close your mouth and let lips touch until dry. It will look funny but don't worry! I let it dry for about 5-10 minutes then peel off! It looks great! I sometimes put Chapstick over top of it if I want that shiny gloss look. After about 6 hours it starts to wear off for me but it will be different for everyone. I love these for nights out or events where I don't want to keep reapplying lipstick. Plus my husband loves it bc he can kiss me without transfer and I can eat and drink with no problem. Last pic I posted was after 4 hours of it on and eating lunch (cherry red was applied that day)

This is a terrific little addition to the make-up case. It's a little challenging to use the first time but after some trial and error it works great.

First you should use a cotton swab to apply it, this gives you a lot more control which is important as this is intended to stain and does.

It takes a while to dry and you must keep your mouth open or you'll have a mess on your hands. Cotton balls under your tongue help help with the extra saliva, not attractive but effective.

You can also use a hair dryer to speed up the process, however the longer it stays on the better the results.

Interpreting it off use a nail brush to scrub your hands if you keep coconut oil on hand it works great for removal.

On average the color lasts around 8-10 hours with eating, drinking, and smoking.

I've recommended this to several friends and my sister and will definitely be purchasing more.

highly recommended , its not irritating and some ingredients are natural like rose hips oil, aloe, natural fruit essence and also with vitamin E.

I love the color and the consistency was OK for me but it doesn't wear well at all. I've worn it twice and both times it chipped almost immediately. I've only had it on for 36 hours and it looks like it has been on for a week...it is so chipped. This is not my usual experience with Essie polishes.

I had the original Chanel Ciel de Nuit back in the 90s and loved the color. I never had the original Essie Starry Starry Night, but I bought the revival today, and like all Essie polishes, I loathe the formula. They're always streaky and clumpy, and the brush is too small and hard to control. Color payoff is good after two coats, not as sparkly as the old Chanel it knocked off, but I wouldn't re-buy. About once a year, I buy an Essie polish, and then remember why I hate them. I should stick to Zoya.

I had been looking for a brush that was actually a hot tool rather than just a hot air brush, but I noticed that it took way more effort to straighten my long thick hair with this than with a flat iron.  It would not tolerate very much hair in the bristles, which is discouraging because the brush head is rather large.  Even after straightening with a flat iron, using the brush to give it some lift, body &/or curl, I just couldn't make it happen without investing much more time than I had patience.

I received this at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have taken it apart twice and replaced the batteries (not easy to do either) and no improvement. The mirror surface is also pretty small and magnification is not good. I like to play with different wig colors and styles and I am ok with the color. Product was alot smaller then I expected but good quality. I love the brush.
I like it but only used a few colors and it runs out fast.
One of the better ones I have tried.  Matches skin and doesn't make me break out if I accidentally leave it on overnight.

I would never buy this product again or recommend to ANYONE. The creams are so terrible, they can barely be applied!! They are NOT spreadable. I might just throw this right out..a day after it came in the mail. SO DISAPPOINTING.
This sucked. Didn't work at all. I would never buy this again. I was extremely dissapointed
The beauty blender was smaller than expected but everything else was perfectly fine and came on time.
This was a multi purpose pallet that I loved to use, I am planning on purchasing a new one as I just recently went through my last one after almost 2 years.
i have ordered this over and over again love it
