Love smoked meats but this was really a waste. Very soft, awful texture and just not good tasting. Needed to be dried much more and better spiced.
they are okay but I won't buy them again for the money, prefer the beef sticks
I bought these last year..And they are great for a snack..Very good product

I love these things.  I used to order from an Ebay seller, but they quit handling the Honey flavored ones.  I went to order the "Buffalo Bills" honey ones here on Amazon, and noticed these Teriyaki ones.  I'm glad I ordered these (along with the honey ones).  The honey ones aren't as sweet as the ones on Ebay were (even though I tracked them down to the same manufacturer, it was a different city listed on the package), so either I got the "mild" variety, or my "taster" has changed (the honey ones were still good, though, I couldn't detect much honey flavor detected)  This review is really for the Teriyaki meat sticks.  The bad thing about these teriyaki meat sticks is that they are somewhat addictive.  In fact, I should end this review so I can order me some more (really).  Thanks, Choo Choo R Snacks, Inc.!

BAD! Not good! This is terrible tasting. It has the texture of patee and teriyaki flavor was not there. Thought it would be a good deal for the price, but I wasted my money. I'm going to give it to the homeless person I see. Too bad, I'm a huge fan of teriyaki beef jerky.

Too soft for my taste, reminds me of the smell dog jerky..
was looking for replacement for Jack Link's Beef Stick, Original, 36-Count Bag (Pack of 2) 33.5oz since it's not for sale anymore, I guess I need to keep looking
I'm a repeat customer. They are better grilled than fresh out of the bag, but taste good uncooked too.
Didn't like the flavor, overly smokey but if you like the smoke flavor then these are for you.

These beef sticks would be good if they didn't have that weird... I can't even call it an aftertaste. It's more of a side taste. My suspicion is that it's the preservatives they use, but it's just weird. At least the texture of the sticks is better than the other ones I tried, but not by much. I'd give these a pass unless you're desperate. Note: This review really applies to these and the "honey stung" variety - the only difference is whether they're slightly spicy or slightly sweet.
Good product that is not greasy . Tastes like old summer sauages that quality meat markets sold back in the 70's. My son takes in his lunch and fishing with Grandpa.
It has a nasty processed taste. Mine were green on the inside from all the preservatives. Really nasty texture
An excellent find, I have two every time I'm in a hurry to work
greasy and had pieces of bone and grizzle in product also MSG is added.
They are amazing. I ate them all over one weekend.
Sorry had a funny taste I had to return this product.  On a good note, the return went smoothly no problem receiving my credit
No taste, poor quality item. Pay a little more get a better brand, well worth it.
these beef sticks are great will order more!.

This review is specifically for the "Buffalo Bills 2lb Spicy 5-inch Ole' Smokies Saddlebag".  Not sure why the reviews lump together different flavors and packagings...  Anyway, I liked 'em.  Good flavor, spicy but not overpowering, good snap.  The smell... well, they smell like spicy dried meat.  It isn't bad but you wouldn't want to wear it as a cologne.  Or maybe you would.  I mean, I don't know you.  Maybe your girl is into that.  It isn't for me to judge.  Anyway, I'll be buying more in the near future.  I preferred these to the other brand I bought here (Old Wisconsin Hardwood Smoked Snack Sticks), although to be fair both were good.
I ate 2 of these and threw the rest of them away they are to soft and taste just like slim Jims
Got the "spicy" type. Not very spicy at all. I prefer the Dearborn brand to these. These are too moist for me. Nuked a few for a better texture

Awful!  I bought these based on reviews and after ordering for the first time I'm extremely disappointed.  I'm not picky at all but these are definitely not for me. I prefer a little more chew to mine and these are soft with very little to zero flavor.  Would not eat these again if they were free.
It was not firm, and too sweet.  My dog did not like them.
Tasted like a stick of grease. Awful, I tossed it away.
Not so good taste like the jerky was still alive yuck
Some of the worst beef sticks I have ever eaten. Didn't taste like beef/meat. And Growing up in PA I've eaten a lot. Terrible smell as well.
Very fatty-no real taste--poor quality compared to Tillamook products.
Great flavor. The only thing I didn't like was the texture was too mushy for me.
little too sweet for my taste, not any spice whatsoever.
Quality was good did not really care for this particular flavor
These beef sticks tasted like hotdogs with a thick casing.  Not what I was looking for or expecting.
wow these are terrible avoid at all costs unless you love dog food or something 0 stars

I love jerky and dried beef sticks but I couldn't stomach more than two of these. Quite disappointed and even though I never send back stuff that I buy, I feel like I should get my money back in this case.
LOUZY TASTE . REAL FAKE TASTE. I HATRED THIS PRODUCT
very very mild taste. I don't like it at all. So I'm posting a 1-star so it can be counted along with the other people who think it's not good.
not good at all, a little like saw dust and a little greasy too, also doesn't taste like meat, very disappointed
Good spicy taste, but unpleasant on the tongue, mushy texture, feels greasy but not actually oily.

First of all I would like to thank Buffalo Bills for gracing the world with their ability to craft the common cow into something more than steak, burgers, and ribs. They made the best beef stick I've ever tasted. Cowboy style smokies, twisted on  the ends, this is the real deal. These little fellas are the perfect snack on that long cattle drive or between rodeos. Every bite has that perfect "snap" when you bite into it. Don't even try to compare these to any inferior meat stick. These Ole' Smokies, are the bee's knees of the meat industry. John Wayne, Clint Eastwood, Chuck Norris, and John Bassalone would be proud.
if u like extremely soft jerky this is for u. just not for me cause i like a some toughness to my jerky

Product arrived as promised, have made my own links this product is ok on taste but is finely ground and texture is horrible if they would grind in not so fine grind this product would be grea I re smoked and dried in oven was ok to eat
They were too tangy (way too sweet but some how sour as well) and too soft. Ended up feeding them to my cats more so than eating them myself. The cats liked them, but I sure didn't.

I just received these today and I will say that the taste is very good. It beats out most other beef sticks I have tried for taste. However, the slight "film" it leaves in my mouth after each bite is slightly icky. If it wasn't for that film, then it would definitely get 5-stars. Not sure if it's just the batch I got or that the sticks are cold, so maybe if I warm them up a bit the film texture goes away?

All in all, great product! Although I was a little disappointed I didn't receive a free sampler like some of the other reviews i saw on here :(.

I love just about anything with honey in it, so I might be a little biased. I received these in the mail the other day and find them great for snacking on while at work. I love the taste and prefer them much better than the stuff I find in our convenient stores. I recommend them to friends and will buy them again as soon as I'm done with this bag.

This product was great, no gristle, meat was tender.
The taste was great, well worth giving it a try.
We enjoyed eating them!

This stuff smells weird and tastes artificial. The center looks like it was squeezed from a tube and tastes powdery. I liked them at first but very quickly decided they were not for me. I very much prefer Old Wisconsin to these.

I ordered these because I love teriyaki and I love beef sticks. But these were terrible. They have a nasty aftertaste. I'm not sure if they are rancid, or just a really bad flavor. I would not order this again!

Good packaging.
Consistent flavour.
I accidentally ordered the honey-stung instead of spicy, which to be honest, are horrible.
My dog loved them, though!

Good for the price, but of this brand I suggest avoiding honey stung and sticking to spicy which ARE great.
Fast shipping but the beef sticks are too soft, I expected is harder inside likes the other brands. The ingredient is good, but I don't like the meat softy inside.  it tasted weird.

The honey-stung ones are bland and not really to my liking, but these teriyaki ones combine the nice texture of a sausage with a sort of snappy skin with a slightly spicy, sweet, and slightly savoury teriyaki flavor.

These are very good.  They are tender and not really dry or super chewy like some jerky products.  Everyone loved them, especially my college age son.  Unfortunately they are somewhat expensive and you can go through $20 worth of the product very quickly.
The sticks I received where mushy and did not have much of a teriyaki flavor. Save your money and buy something else.

I am no expert but I have tried my fair share of beef snack stick, even from different countries, this is the single most horrible tasting thing I tried. Also, the texture of it is dry and crumbles in your mouth, how is this possible? Shouldn't it be chewy?

I have no idea how the product is prepared but I can tell you the final product is not worth the price nor the time.

After trying 2 sticks I have put the rest in the trash already.
They're good but not as good as beef sticks from our local grocery. They're okay but I won't be ordering more. The other bag is in the freezer.
Really unpleasant tasting, very high fat, very poor quality meat. Made me wonder what the cow had done to deserve its fate. Second ingredient? Beef Hearts.

i thought that these sticks taste like paper and were greaser than others I've had
i like the extra smoke jerky better
One of the bags had a rip in it and ruined half of the product. The other half was just not good. Big disappointment.
Ok, needs more flavor to make them taste better. I'm not buying them again until they are improved. Much better products out there.
...maybe im just a normal person who can not adapt this kind of flavor...cant imagine why some people said they like it...
This is how pepperoni should be, moist yet with a good snap when you bite into it  not too salty, smoke and flavored just right.

The outside of these is simply perfect for a mild meat stick: the honey gives it a nice sweetness and the wrapper has a nice snap to it when you bite into it. The inside, however, tastes almost exactly like a Slim Jim. I find Slim Jims to be a guilty pleasure, so I was ok with this, but these do taste like they are made of cheaper, fattier meat than what I prefer, so I probably will not be buying this product again.

If you really like Slim Jims, give this a shot. Otherwise I would pass. Giving it a four because it's exactly as advertised and quite tasty, just not exactly my thing.

Or just fake tasting beef sticks?

Either way they were terrible.

2nd star for edibility during times of extreme hunger/famish.
These are some of the best tasting jerky sticks i've tried but I couldn't get the taste of heart out of my head after reading the ingredients, something of a personal problem though...

Soft. Mushy. Moist.

These are the tree words that best describe these sticks. I was definitely expecting these sticks to be dryer and chewier.

The flavor is pretty good . . . but the texture makes these a "thumbs-down" for me.

Addictive, Delicious, much better than the Slim Jims some other reviews have likened it to.  I got one of these in 4 days ago and it lasted for all of 2 and a half days.  I just ordered another package.  These have a high fat content which you can taste when you bite into one.  The taste is predominantly salty with a spicy kick and a noticeable, but not overpowering, hint of honey.  Additionally there is a subtle acid bite,  These are good right out of the bag but they can also be used in cooking.  I chopped a few up and added them to pancakes- delicious.  They would probably also go good in breakfast burritos, cous cous, or rice.  You can't go wrong with these babys.
The "meat" has a creamy texture like biting into a stick of brie cheese.  Principal ingredient is pured cow hearts.  Each stick has 14% of the USDA daily fat allowance.  I wouldn't feed it to my dog.
Guess its just personal preference, but don't like them. Ended up giving them away and using them as dog treats.
I think these are great, but the packaging is so so.  It's a bulk pack.  They are not individually wrapped.  You have to put them in smaller ziploc bags to keep them from going stale.
These were a very good value compared to convenience store beef sticks. A bit mushy. Could be drier. I keep them in fridge.
Good, light taste.  Not too strong of a flavoring, and very little, if any, aftertaste.  They go down easy,...MMMmm.  Definitely happy with the purchase.

I learned about these from a co-worker after he made a bulk purhcase of several kinds of beef sticks a year ago.  He spread them around and so I got to sample a variety: I've ordered the Honey Stung four times since then. Two other co-workers have also ordered them on several occassions this past year and they're "believers" too.  Additionally, we've all ordered several of the Buffalo Bills brands and they're all superb!  As long as you don't eat the whole bag, I'd also call these "Atkins friendly" as well, as that is also a motivator for me ordering these so many times (other than them being just being great, well-seasoned snacks).  Buy 'em, you'll love 'em!
I enjoyed this product.  They are a good value for the amount you get.  I did not sense much honey in the product, so a bit more flavor would be nice.  I would buy again.
I though it was fresh, moist;  However, personally alittle to sweet for me.  I think i`ll stick with the John Wayne brand.  JW brand is more expensive but it seems to soot my taste buds better.

I was a little skeptical on ordering the teriyaki sticks version based on a couple of reviews but, I am happy I did. They were a soft stick as someone said but had a nice crunch when you bit in. The teriyaki was milder than others I have ordered and they were more smokey but they are called ole' smokeys. I did not get the greasy mouth feel that someone said and it did have a pleasant tasting after taste. All in all, worth a 4* rating... but it could be a 5 based on individual tastes.

These snacks are very different than, say, Slim Jims. They are moist and seems less processed than many of the convenience store meat snacks out there. There was a nice hint of spice laced with honey. I would say they tasted and had a texture that I might have expected in a more expensive product. I will buy them again and will recommend them to friends and family.

I bought the Buffalo Bills Teriyaki Ole' Smokies beef sticks because I absolutely LOVE beef sticks, especially teriyaki, and I thought this would be a good buy - good quantity for the price.

The teriyaki beef sticks themselves were very tasty and flavorful. I also loved the texture, it was very soft and tender.

The only bad thing I'd have to say about this product is that it leaves me with a very greasy, fatty residue all over the rood of my mouth, which kind of takes away from the flavor and my ability to FULLY enjoy the product. Aside from that, I may still order it again. :)

I purchased the Honey Stung Smokies and some of the reviews stated that they were mushy, I wouldn't go that far, but they are softer then most beef sticks but they still have a 'snap' to them. The taste is great, even the picky kids liked these smokies-I think we will try some of the other flavors. plus order these again.
really great snack for hiking or a baseball game....My son and I enjoy taking them when we go on a road trip to hold us over till we find a good restaurant!
Taste great, once in awhile you will come across a pocket of fat but its worth the risk. Anything from this supplier is good quality and value.

These have a good snap when you bite into them and a nice honey beef taste!
Choo Choo R Snacks always has excellent customer service, and they throw in a few samples as well!

I really enjoyed these beef sticks. Even though I preferred them to be a little bit harder, they were tasty. I just put them in the frig and that worked out fine. Nice flavor, not too sweet or spicy. They sure didn't last in my house!

I love this product and order it quite often for my big boys to take hunting. Just wish the seller would take the time and money to change the label to say Mild instead of spicy. It isn't spicy and they have at least put a sticker on the package but have not changed the discription on line so I thought I was actually purchasing spicy this time. Still a wonderful product.
Could only find at local Shell gas station......now I have a source to buy all I want!  Fast & secure delivery....price is great!  Will order again, and again, etc.,.....

Growing up I always loved foods with a flavor punch. Favorite salami was this paprika kind - my brother and I would eagerly stand around my mother as she'd cut thin slices for our snack or for a party tray. This salami reminds me of those moments, but I do regret ever introducing my husband to it. It seems there is never enough for me! We love it so much we hide it from our guests. This is our personal stash! Now if only it didn't cost so much to get it to Hawaii, hence the missing 5th star the salami itself deserves.

The Bende salami tastes kind of like the Pick Salami but the texture is different. Bende is softer and hence a little difficult to slice thinly. I still think Pick is the best but Bende is a good alternative if Pick is not available.
I have been looking for real Hungarian kolbasz (sausage) or salami but could find only imitations. This one is very good and I would buy it again and recommend it to those who like spicy sausages.
Knowing the Hungarians, they like a lot of fat/heavy stuff.  It tasted good but LOTS OF FAT.  Would buy again for ethnic reasons

Not good.  Mediocre flavor.  Packaged to look authentic, but made in USA.  A small residual portion of most bites resists pulverization by chewing and needs to be spit out.  Don't know if this is due to the addition of some type of inedible filler or what, but whatever the cause it's very unappetizing and unsatisfactory.  All in all, a very disappointing and inferior product.
Love Hungarian salami and apparently so does my granddaughter. Very good.
Disgusting. Meat products can not be imported. All sausages are made locally. What a waste!
This is the closest thing on Amazon to the Hungarian version of the Kolbasz, with only a moderate amount of fat.
It is a good salami. I love the originals in Hungary.

Very good salami.  I liked the texture and the good flavors.  Not bland at all.  When sliced, it does not have that greasy, slick and slimy feel of packaged grocery-store salami.  I can't compare it to the authentic made-in-Hungary salami as I have not had that in years.  I would definitely buy this again.
It is nothing like a Hungarian salami, it could be any old salami.
Not cheap, but it's tasty, so I like it, and keep ordering this one.

I took a chance on these considering the mixed reviews and found the grapes to be a solid product. Yes, they are a bit more tart than some green grapes, but I personally enjoy a grape that is not completely sweet. I would have given it the highest rating, except that about a third of the grapes were borderline miniature in my particular package (regardless of taste, I prefer them to be large and plump). I queued them up for purchase again in my Amazon Fresh cart and will likely make my ultimate determination based on the two orders (increasing my sample size).

I ordered the organic and the regular green seedless grapes to compare for my own curiosity.  The organic were way more flavorful and I would not have considered them at all tart as stated in another review, and I'm guessing it may be the time of year and these were more in the peak of the season.  But for sure the organic were full of flavor and firm.
I like tart but these are too tart.  No one will eat them.  Threw them outside for the birds.
These were GREAT for the price. Sweetest green organic grapes I've had, and I've bought others in retail stores.

If you have never eaten a grape in your life, then I highly recommend that you do. It was a life changing spiritual experience for me and I'm sure it will be for you. My fourth eye (nope, not third eye) was pried open immediately after eating just one of these delicious grapes. You can only imagine how much insight I had on the nature of human life and its purpose after eating an entire bowl of them. That's just what grapes do. Specifically green grapes.

Please do not ask about red, purple, or black grapes. Zen Master Reviewer Seattle has no business with such unenlightened talk. Excuse me while I go live with a group of monks in Lhasa for the next five years to share these delicious grapes with them. Namaste!
Dry, i can't eat them, kids spat them out. So out to the birds they go. Waste of money.
I like it, but wish it was less expensive.
The first time I ordered them they were good, flavorful grapes. My second order I received tasteless grape that I ended up throwing away. Not sure if I want to try ordering again.
sweet and crunchy grapes, what more could you ask for

These were really tasteless - I bought them because they were actually cheaper than the regular grapes, but it wasn't worth it. They're a lot firmer than regular grapes, so I wonder if they're just unripe? I don't think I know what an unripe grape looks like. Anyway, I don't recommend. It's a waste of your money.
Very good, very sweet. But I may have received the wrong ones, since it has tons of seeds. Either way... tasted good!
These were huge and crispy, but had absolutely no flavor.
Organic Green Seedless Grapes, 2 lb Came with moldy produce.
Arrived clean, in good shape, healthy looking.  Unfortunately, they taste like water.

I have been buying a lot of grapes lately, every week. So, in trying Amazon Fresh for the first time, I ordered 3 of these (approx $16 of my $50 order, so these were a big deal to me). They initially looked really good, big, round, plump, juicy. However, I discovered a majority of them had huge black spots on them. Then, in eating them, I found the flavor to range from tasteless to dirt, and yes, I washed them well. I can hardly bring myself to eat them, and think it was a horrible waste of money. I am canceling Amazon Fresh. Extremely disappointed.
Great deal for organic grapes!  Will purchase again next week.
There were spider webs and a bug in this package. NOPE
Very tiny and too expensive for the size. Picture shows them besides an orange and tangarine.

I've ordered this item twice now through Amazon fresh. In both cases, they arrived in good condition and I enjoyed them. In the second case, I didn't get around to cooking it until about a week later, and it was still good.
I purchased two squash. One squash was rotten inside and full of worms. Thankfully the other one was usable.
Tasty & fresh. Amazon Fresh product growers are the best.
Hopefully I just received a bad one but it was rotten and unusable.  It went directly to the trash.

This is the biggest joke of a spaghetti squash. It was about 5 inches long (fit entirely in my tiny hands). I pay the same price for a HUGE spaghetti squash in the grocery store, and this wasn't even 1/4 of the size. I won't be ordering spaghetti squash from Amazon again.
Very small squash and when cooked was soggy.
The two squashes I received today are tiny. They're the size of grapefruits- ridiculous!  I will never buy these again
Lately I've gotten pretty decent sized ones...but every once in a while I get a super small one not at all worth the price.
Spaghetti squash is such a great alternative to pasta. We love that you taste more of the sauce and you're getting more nutrients than when you have pasta.

Way, WAAAY too small. Looks fresh, and I'm going to cook it (for myself...), but for $3.99, there should definitely be, well, MORE. Won't buy again.

(ps, that's a nickel, ran out of dollars)

Soooo small and over priced - a medium spaghetti squash should be able to feed two people and mine is so small it will barely feed me. Now I have to go to the store and get another one for dinner which defeats the purpose of ordering online :(
Wonderfully sized spaghetti squash for noodles that are nutritious natural and gluten free. Makes a wonderful dish. Recommended for all humans.

Didn't taste at all natural like a real key lime pie.  I recommend that you skip this flavor of this product and instead try the lemon and strawberry flavors, which are much better.  They have a more natural taste.  On the positive side, this product is sugar free, low in calories and easy to make.  In general this company's products are very good.  It is just this particular flavor of the product that is lacking.
I made a pie  with the mousse and it was terrific. I even reorded it ,it was so good.
I like more lime flavor. lt didn't seem to have enough!!
what you wrote about your product made me think your product is cake for diabetic but I  very dispointed when open it,  I don know what to do with your product!
Taste great, good for my diabetes. If anything, it is costly, more than if I bought it from my local store. Which is hard to find, where I live.
Vey easy preparation, just 5 minutes with a mixer.  Whips up a very tasty treat.  Can use as a pie filling or a dessert mousse.  Low cal but big taste.
This product makes a great pie, no sugar and taste great.  I have only tried the key lime flavor, but I will try more flavored.  Great choice if you are diabetic.
so far I am doing good with the product.
not sure how much spenda is in it...very bland with a sharp key lime flavor.
Ick. Just plain ick.  Tasted foul, really foul.  Tasted really really 'chemical' with no key lime flavor at all.  Booooo!
Tried adding extra lime juice and still couldn't detect much lime flavor.  Like their chocolate flavors but not this one.
Tasted like funky chemicals.  As a diabetic I was hoping for something tasty but this didn't cut it.  Bleck. Icky.

It's not too good until it's thoroughly chilled in fridge for @ least 5 hrs. I've ceased to order this product because I've found it @ 1/2 the price @ my local grocery store in the sugar free foods. This is not something I would order again
Not particularly good.  The Key Lime flavor was off and the texture wasn't up to the standards of the chocolate flavors.  I won't buy this again.
Used the mix for parfaits (using a tall glass, alternated layers of prepared mix and whipped cream). Made a very refreshing, light desert.
I purchased this product because I am diabetic and was wanting Key Lime Pie. This tasted great and I would buy it again.
This is one of my favorites for a light dessert.  Great after a fish dinner or salad supper.  Refreshing in the summertime: light texture and delightful taste.
i was looking forward o trying this product...but it tasted really chemical and plastic...very disappointing!
Too bad it is gone. It is my boyfriend's fave. Unfortunately if it goes past the fresh date it does get a little stale. But put it in the microwave. It will taste yummy!
Always awesome. Already in the freezer for the future is that my son can enjoy also and know what I had as a child.
Sweet rolled cakes. My favorites.! They're the best chocolate cake you've ever tasted. And the company is going out of business.? Or, that's what we thought. We don't know yet. I'm stocking up.
This is just plain ridiculous!  Seriously who in the right mind would pay such a high price for a box of hostess snacks! Save your money for things that you need!
awful taste. the Ho Ho's of yesteryear are long gone.

I was hopeful that the West Coast version of Yodels would be high quality, much like Ding Dongs to Ring Dings. No such luck. The chocolate is cheap, the sponge cake poor, and the cream filling cheap. These were closer to Walmarts brand of these cakes (which are particularly bad) than to Yodels.
What in the world did they do to the ho ho's?!  They shrunk them by half and they taste dry and stale...what a disappointment :(
I little over priced and gave me explosive doodies
I loved ho-hos when I was a kid and they are very hard to find in my area. I bought these as a fun little extra for my husband at Christmas. They were old and stale. Yuck.
Both boxes tasted stale and the chocolate coating fell off all of them.

Smaller than I thought they would be but they were good, the serving size is 3 hoho's. They weren't stale or close to expiration like some other's experienced. Can't complain about getting HoHo's in the mail haha.
Not like they used to be but still good

These have changed since I had them 10 years ago. The chocolate is not as waxy, therefore you cannot unroll it from the cake any longer. The filling is a little more dense and seems like it's marshmallow based with a powdered sugar taste. The chocolate sponge cake is a drier cake.

I am on the Ideal Protein diet and there are not too many things outside of the program that I can eat. Walden Farm products are hit or miss, and this is a hit. It is a delicious addition to the veggies that I MUST eat everyday. I can have as much of this as I want - 0 carbs/0 sugar/0 fat/0 calories/0 gluten/0 carbs. This is awesome on celery and a lifesaver in a world (my world) where there is no flavor.

Don't expect real ranch, but I would use this over the ranch dressing anyday but just add a splash of water. I would cheat a bit and add 2 tbsp of low-fat buttermilk with 2 tbsp of the ranch dip and boom good ranch dressing.

I am now searching all over for Walden farms products,and I have had good and bad experiences, the salad dressings and dips so far have been good,but the sweeter products (choc dip,marshmallow dips) are awful.  This bacon dip is nice,good to dip carrots/veg.
Nice to have a dip that meets my need to add something special to my diet!  Great for Ideal Protein!

I tried to get a local grocer to carry this but I would have to purchase a case n order to do this. I am actually considering this if it is cheaper than amazon. Seriously I used it on everything u tul the jar was gone. Celery sticks and this dip, on salad, on an omelet for breakfast in stead of sour cream, even took it to a restaurant. It is that good that I will be looking t buy more. I bought 2 jars and I am on my last one :( if you are the only person using t it can last you 2 weeks if you only use a teaspoon or so per serving. I don't use a lot as I am used to lemon and some seating on salads, so this is a real treat! Did. Mention no calories? You could use more if you want, it just won't last long.
This is a great dip and makes plain old carrots and celery taste decadent and marvelous. Congratulations to whoever came up with this product and recipe.

I really like the Walden Farms Ranch salad dressing so I thought I would like this dip. I used it with a rice chip and the first taste was OK. However, after about 5 seconds, there was a strong pepper bite on the back of my tongue. Since I am not overly fond of pepper, I found this to be a huge drawback. Also, the dip had an oily consistency. I wound up throwing this product out. I would only recommend it to someone who likes a pepper burn. From now on, I'll stick to the Walden Farm salad dressing and make my own low cal dip.

Good enough taste and consistency - replicates a ranch dip pretty well...but then the aftertaste hits you. It's got some kind of a fertilizer/chemical-y note on the back end that's off-putting enough to make me and my wife not eat any after the first few trial tastes. Not their best product for sure.
Every one of these products are perfect for competition training and meal preps!
The consistency is not what I would call "creamy" and the flavor is not what I would call "bacon." A bit more like a film prop than an actual food.
it tastes too artificial.  did not like the flavor at all.
pretty dreadful - I like my other Walden Farms products though
Not exactly ranch flavored, but not terrible? Meh.
They made my nephew almost throw up! They were for his birthday. I'll never forget the look on his face :(

I bought this for my daughter because she loves pickle flavored anything. When we opened it up to try them they just tasted old no pickle flavor what so ever. We found a date on the package of 2010. Thanks for nothing

After reading other reviews of these gumballs, I really expected the flavor to be more pronounced. I purchased these for my nephews for Easter. They were amused at the novelty factor and the nice tins. The whole family tried the gumballs and I think we all expected them to be more flavorful. Pickles have a pretty strong flavor, and these just didn't come close. If someone had given me one and told me to guess the flavor, I would have never guessed pickle. They are kind of bland to be honest.
They made a great Christmas gag gift--especially since our father and uncles were in the pickle business for 30 years.
this gum has a unique and pleasant flavor,if you love dill pickels,this gum is for you.buy a pack today.happiness will ensue.
My daughter loved this pickle gum.  She thought it taste was awesome. Pickle gum that has long lasting flavor. Yum Yum
Funny and filled purpose, but didn't taste like pickles which I don't know if that is good or bad lol.

i order this pickle gum as a gag gift ,  came in a big box but a very small package  it was cute  was fun when someone opened it, but then u do try it an theres not much of a pickle taste  an what little taste there is  goes fast
Great gag gift, the flavor doesnt last long but its cheap! I <3 it, my friends love it. Everyone you get it for will lov eit. Obviously not educational.. But, it doesnt even taste that bad!
Terrible!! Waste of money!!! Did not taste like pickle at all
It doesn't taste like pickles. Complete load. I want my money back. It is just regular gumballs. Why does it say pickle on the packaging if it doesn't taste like pickles?
The taste was awful. It had a chemical taste and wasn't sour at all.

Pickle flavored gumballs!!  Yes please!
I love any sort of vegetable inspired confections.
If you're the type who enjoys cabbage milkshakes you'll love these.
tastes like dill pickle tater chips and medicine
just got this and will be used for a gift for valentines day to go with the lip balm

It's pickle flavored gum...
Great as a GAG gift, or a gag gift.
Rather than a 1 it deserves a 0 out of 5. It tastes like medical cream rather than pickles. Don't waste your money on this crap!
they were meant to make him smile but he actually really liked them
Didn't really taste pickle flavor but I like this gumball.
I bought the Pickle Flavored Gumballs for my grandson and he was thrilled with it.
The gum is gross it tasted like puke
product received was stale and tasted nothing like pickles. oh well, gag gift so it's just wasted $$ anyways.
The idea of these are great, especially for a gag gift, but they do not taste like pickle. They do not taste good at all, they have a rancid taste.
These don't taste like pickles at all they just taste like overly sweetened bubble gum with like a very faint vinegar taste
This is a great product for Raffles and fun! Great! Recommend! Quite good footnote price and quality!
These were a gift for my mom and my aunt. They both super loved them and said they were delicious!

In my opinion, these have no pickle taste to them whatsoever.  It is more a wax/plastic taste.  Reminds me more of medicine than pickles.  If you really like pickles do not get your hopes up with these.  I bought these on a whim to try and I will not be buying them again
They taste terrible. A lot like hotdogs and pickles mixed together, and they are very small. Buy for a joke.
Pickle flavored gumballs does not taste anything like pickles!  It has no taste to it!  Buyers be aware it is A crappy product!

I ordered this as a gag, but I ended up liking them.  They only taste a bit like pickles, but there is enough saltiness to contrast with the sweet.  Salty sweet happens to be my favorite taste.  I am kind of hooked on these.
I ordered these for a friend who is a pickle fanatic and she was so excited. And they really do taste like pickles!
It tastes nothing like pickles. It tastes like regular bubble gum. It's a rip-off. Although if you want bubble gum with a cool pickle package then I would by it.

Not too sweet, but sweet enough; and refreshing with a nice little carbonated kick. This energy drink is a very welcome deviation from other energy drinks out there that I, quite frankly, can't stomach. Also, the ingredient list is actually, true to its name, HEALTHY! Imagine that. The first seven ingredients are a variety of fruit juices and water. Then other than caffiene and stevia (the healthy sugar additive that actually possesses antioxidant properties) and a little carbonation, that's it. This is one energy drink I will gladly keep on hand.

Was not a fan AT ALL, brought a 12 pack and barely drank one, anyone want it??? Only tried the apple but probably won't try the others. It tastes like fake apple, like a green blowpop - even tho it is real.

I sampled this last week when I was walking near Bryant Park in NYC and the marketing people were handing out free samples (full cans) of Jamba Juice energy drinks. I grabbed one since it was free and I was really thirsty. The drink did not tasted good: I could feel the sour taste and low level of sweetness, like it was sweetened with aspartame. I drank about half of the can and threw the remained into the rain drain grate on the street. I would never pay for this drink, but I would accept it for free to clear my throat when I am thirsty.

I really enjoyed this product.

Some energy drinks have negative side effects, e.g., headaches, shakes, terrible taste, etc.

I found Jamba to be both flavorful and gave me a noticeable increase in energy without a killer headache or the shakes.

I have a cup of green tea every morning & that's enough to keep me going. Since I was sleep deprived I thought it'd be a good day to try Jamba strawberry banana energy drink. The taste was better than I anticipated, like real juice, very slight carbonation with no detectable aftertaste. I had it along with my lunch at 1pm. Wish I had known that the 80mg of caffeine it contains is about 3 times as much as in a cup of green tea. I need to stay awake til about 11pm but I hope it doesn't keep me up all night.
It is impossible to rate this product as we never did receive it. I have friends that use it and like it but I have no personal experience with it.

I really didn't enjoy the taste of this energy drink at all.  I thought it was a too sweet, and then there was this bitter after taste at well.  It's also a very small can, especially in comparison to a lot of other energy drinks out there in the market, so even if it had tasted very good I still wouldn't have thought this was an ideal choice.

Needing a mid afternoon jump start at work, I have tried various sodas, fruit drinks, teas and so called "energy drinks" that were ranged from awful to so-so.  I was never impressed with one product to try it again.  The crisp, but not overly sweet taste combined with a still hit of caffeine (that did not make me shaky or interfere with night-time sleep) made this a winner for me.  I did not notice any aftertaste and it did not the cloying flavor of regular apple juice.  It will be included in my supplies that get me through a long work day. Enjoy!

If you like the taste of some of the other, bull-ish energy drinks, than enjoy. If you like the energy from those other drinks, but would rather drink something a little more palatable, you might want to try the Jamba Juice Energy Drink. No, it doesn't taste like apple juice, but there are enough hints of apple to drown out most of the nasty caffeine flavor that is usually present in these drinks. If this doesn't sound like a ringing endorsement, that's because it isn't. That said, if you are going to use energy drinks, this is a pretty good one.

A crisp delicious beverage to give me a buzz without making me feel guilty for drinking from some large, dressed up, purple can covered in bolts of lightning.  I love Jamba Juice smoothies and the energy drink didn't lower my opinion of the sweet and healthy treats.  Apple may not be my favorite flavor and the can was too small to give me complete satisfaction, but it was crisp, delicious and came in a very nice looking can.

Jamba Juice is pretty well known in NYC as having great, fresh made fruit and vegetable drinks.  I'm a fan.  So when I got out of the subway station one morning to find a group of people handing out free samples of these canned juice energy drinks I figured I'd give it a try based on reputation.  I'm not big on energy drinks - if I want a lift, coffee is my go-to.

I was sorely disappointed.  I couldn't even get past one sip.  If I want apple juice, I'll just go and get me a regular old apple juice, thank you.  I'm not big on artificial sweeteners and while I'm aware that stevia is natural, it still has a strange taste to it.  Even my boyfriend, who has gotten used to beverages with stevia, said he couldn't get past the first few swallows either. It tasted unnatural to him as well.

Both of us, unknown to each other - threw them out in the garbage.

Jamba would have been better off canning some of their delicious juice drinks instead.  That, I would buy.

Id rather take a nap or have a coffee, the flavor of this was so uninteresting, I even like apple cider but this tasted like something you try once and forget about. The labeling of drinks as "energy drinks" is such a joke, half of these products probably only manage to irritate the body, you're better off taking a nap or like I said having a small cup of coffee or tea. Jamba Juice totally missed the mark on this one, it tasted off and would have been even more disappointing if I paid for it.

This Jamba Juice Energy Drink is tasty and refreshing with a nice tangy aftertaste to it.  The energy drink did not give much of a boost but I did not feel particularly slow after drinking it either, maybe it just gives you even keel of energy than others where you get a noticeable boost (and a noticeable crash later in the day too).

I ordered this item based on the Jamba Juice name and was pretty disappointed. I like tart apples but this is not enjoyable at all. I didn't notice a significant increase in my energy either, I drank it during a break at work. Glad I got to try one for free, not worth the price.

The Jamba Juice Natural Energy Drink in the crisp apple flavor is very tasty. The flavor reminds me apple cider. I like it a lot and will purchase it if I can find it stores, which I have not been able to in my area. Hopefully it will arrive soon!! 4 stars!

I know that a lot of people are enamored with energy drinks these days; I'm not one of them.  Most of the energy drinks out there might as well be battery acid for the flavor, and I'm not sure why anyone would drink one save for the fact that it provides a "boost" through copious amounts of sugar and/or caffeine (and/or taurine, etc., etc.).

However, Jamba's entry of "Crisp Apple" is quite delicious and refreshing, even as a simple beverage.  I'm not normally inclined to drink energy drinks, but I could easily see drinking something like this on an a regular basis.  I highly recomend this!!

Jamba crisp apple is aptly named.  The slender 8.4 oz (248 mL) can has 90 calories, 20 g of sugar and 80 mg caffeine. There are 22 total carbs.  With 80 mg of caffeine it has a little pick me up. It is best served chilled.  The flavor is good, but has a slight aftertaste, which isn't wholly unpleasant.  Maybe the aftertaste is the stevia. It is carbonated and not too sweet. It is 70% juice.  I shared a can with my husband. His comments were sour but sweet. He asked if it was diet. I told him about the stevia and he said that was probably the taste he was noticing. Overall, I like it.  It is the type of drink I might get at a sandwich shop more than purchasing a case.

This is the second flavor I have had of the Jamba Juice energy drink line. I like this one even more than the last. If you like apple, you will like this product. It's full of flavor and tastes great. It's not gritty or over carbonated like a lot of energy drinks. It tastes natural and delicious!

I was hopeful this would work in my Keurig K-Cup Reusable filter.  It didn't.  I had coffee and coffee grounds everywhere!  Now I have yet another batch of coffee I can't use.  (I don't even know how it tastes.  I didn't want to clean up the mess, so I didn't try to make a 2nd cup.)

The Sumatra coffee is my favorite of the EkoJava blends [I've tried French Roast and Honduras House]. It has a nice bold flavor and the packet size is great for the re-usable k-cups [solofill or my k-cup type].  I'll purchase again.

I found the grind too fine for my solo refillable/reusable cup...it clogs the mesh and only brews about 1/3 of a cup...when I use a regular k cup disposable it brews a full cup. Also if I use my solo refillable with regular grind (Maxwell House for example) it brews a full cup. So I cannot use my ekojava except tearing open several and putting in my regular coffee make! :-( not happy! EkoJava, Sumatra Single Serve Coffee for Solofill Cup, 25-Count Solofill Cup, Refillable K-Cup For Keurig K-Cup Brewers

It's so hard to find a quality, grade one, single origin coffee. I got the product and immediately tried it. The flavor was incredible and the stick packs were nice, but I hope they will come out with a bulk (not in stick packs), pre-ground coffee option in the near future. Other than that, I could not be more impressed or pleased with the product.

Very good coffee. I like bold, strong coffee and this very nearly fills the bill; I brew 12-ounce cups and it's good; 10- or 8-ounce cups even better for my taste. No mess, nice canister, good coffee. The price is decent when it's on sale for $10; I think the list price is too steep.

I brew it in a solo cup with an ez filter. Less mess, less waste (of water. I don't like the amount of water I waste rinsing away coffee grounds.)

I'd like to see them come up with a stronger blend, a variety pack, and a refill option to cut down on price and packaging even more.
Great product, good tase and convienent to use. However using the ECO basket is cheaper and use your own coffee
Sorry to say this but I found the EkoJava single serve coffee to be too bitter for my taste. I used the single-serve canister in our Keureg but after two cups - I gave up.

I ordered this along with the french roast. The taste is "off" as someone else stated. Brewed using the ecobrew with my keurig and had "sludge" at the bottom of the cup. Gave it a 2 instead of a 1 due to packaging. Guess I'll stick to my current brand.

My review is impacted by the use of this coffee and brew method - not on the sole quality of the taste.

We bought two EkoBrew baskets, a can of the Sumatran, and one of the Honduran. When the Sumatran refused to brew a full cup we contacted the company. Received a nice email that explained the grind was "pre EkoBrew" and they admit to it not working well with their single serve basket. That being said, they apologized and suggested for us to use less coffee with a smaller cup setting - as well as offering us a refund for the inconvenience.

So, I'm not sure if the taste is fantastic enough for more than two stars, since I can't brew a proper cup with their own product. I gave them an extra star for customer service.
Coffee is a good medium roast; however, I am about halfway through the canister, and have run  across a couple of packages that had a much smaller amount of coffee in them.
I ordered this to go with the new plastic solo k-cups, I will never drink it and will probably throw it away.

Mighty great coffee, awesome one day sale pricing, and cool old fashion packaging. One problem, liked to never of broken into the goods. That top was really glued on, not good for old farts with bad hands. A rusty knife may work, but I sure don't want to cut some precious coffee packets. Some kind of pull string, like on those old dog food bags, or a ductape seal would do the trick.

Well, shiver me timbers. I just learned. via another old fart, that there is a secret passage into the EkoJava coffee chest. By golly, there's a hidden perforation under the label, no signs or maps, about two inches down from the top, that opens the goods real smart. Just run a fingernail around the perforation and twist the top right off. Who would of ever guessed?

Now, more Java for me mates.

I have tried 3 different blends of this coffee and think they are great. I use the solofill, but am thinking of buying ekobrew cup. Even with the solofill or ekobrew cup this is a good buy and your not putting all those kcups in the landfill.
This is the perfect measuring of coffee for the Keurig. Tastes great, nice bold (but not too strong) coffee. You can't beat the price

This product is not for everyone.  It is high in fat and is perhaps a little too salty for many on a restricted diet.

For those of us who grew up in the south in the 40's through the 70's, this was a staple at the breakfast table.  We did not have it everyday but when we did it was a treat.

The secret to making this sausage taste right is in how you prepare it.  First, don't use a pan that will allow the sausage to stick.  Use either a well seasoned cast iron skillet or a non-stick frying pan.  Heat it until the sausage turns light brown and starts to stiffen.  Basically, cook most of the moisture out of it. If you are going to scramble eggs into the cooked sausage, mix between 4 and six into the pan.  Don't over stir the eggs or they will be mealy or crumbly.  Again, the secret is too brown the sausage for the best taste.

Lastly, this sausage may not be meant for everyone.

While shipping was fast on this itemit is nowhere near being sausage in looks or taste. I opened a can expecting sausage patties and to my surprise it was full of mush that looked like cat food, and tasted nothing like sausage. Overall this item is a waste of money in my opinion. Even my dog refused to eat it.

very satisfied ,hard to find in this area was surprised to find on Amazon but sure glad I did , if you're from the country and like biscuits and eggs and gravy banner sausage makes it complete just heat in a skillet and mix with gravy , its delicious ..........Enjoy
Not good.  Can't believe they sell this to humans.

I Love Banner sausage. Unfortunately, I can't buy it at a local grocery store. The product gets 5 stars, Amazon gets a firm 2 stars on service and delivery.., it didn't take 1, not 2, but 3 attempts at getting this product. Each time, they sent Vienna weiners. Evidently, there was a warehouse problem or items were mislabeled on the scan codes. In the end, I finally got the case I ordered.

This isn't sausage like I would get at a restaurant. It's not a patty. Actually, when you open the can, it's a soft consistency. Simply scrape it out in a bowl and microwave for a couple minutes. It's soft and runny. Mix it with scrambled eggs or biscuits and gravy, it's truly awesome!
I didn't see anything on the description that indicated a "tripe" mash. I would not have ordered a case of mushy cow stomachs if I had known.
My Dad wanted this because he grew up eating it. Came in a week before he passed.
Virtually impossible to find locally -- but had this as a boy growing up and still like.

My boyfriend use to eat Banner sausage down south years ago when he was in the Navy. He talked about it all the time he had me order 2 cases of it. Well he tried a can and gave a few away so other people he told about it could try it. Now I have a case and 3 cans sitting here no one will eat it. He said it don't taest anything like it did when he use to eat it. Sorry to say but my cats cand cat food smell's better than that.
I used to eat this as a child  It is delicious..
I threw it away....even with two cats...I would not allow my poor cats to eat this crap.  Boo.  Smells like Arse,  looks like Arse and most likely made out of Cow & Pig Arse.
Not good at all. Label suggests a sausage party, but it is a loose mixture. Odd smell. Even the dog would not eat it.
I tend to like stuff that most people don't like, but no.

If you following the instructions on the can you loose what it is meant for. I grow up mixing it in breakfast gravy and biscuits. That is that best way to have. Just warm it in the microwave for two minutes then mix and your gravy.
Exactly what I wanted but needs better packaging .
It makes a wonderful breakfast dish, served with fried potatoes, eggs and biscuits.
OMG this stuff is bad. I put it on a pizza and we had to throw it away and go out to eat. Very bad stuff

After relocating several years ago, I was in the habit of purchasing of the sausage while visiting my home town since it isn't sold locally.  I was very pleased discovering that I could order online.  It's a special treat on weekends when Dad fixes breakfast using this sausage.
I spray a glass pie plate with spray, open can and put on dump out in plate. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes.
For my taste personally it was almost exactly like the ole potted meat.  I was disappointed because I was expecting precooked sausage patties.
Expected sausage patties. Wife couldn't form them. Flavor was worse, fed to dogs. I'll keep looking for a better product.

And I haven't acquired it after trying it.  I bought one can for $1.68 at Bottom Dollar food store.  When I first opened the can it looked and smelled disgusting. The first thing I thought of was canned cat food; canned dog food seems a little more appetizing. I decided to try it anyway. After all I like canned Spam and sort of like those little canned sausages.  I tried it with eggs, just like the instructions on the can say.  I didn't like the taste or consistency at all and could not eat all of the product that I made.  It was also very, very salty. Since I don't have a cat or dog to feed the leftovers to I ended up throwing it away.  Too bad it didn't work out because I like to keep a few cans of protein food in the cupboard and now I know that this will not be one of them.
good to have doing the winter month's . they also go with some hot butterdown grits and don't forget the egg's.

Bought this stuff to add to my emergency rations, but I have to agree with the other negative review here; this stuff was awful.  Tasted nothing like sausage, even on a pizza.  I'm a canned and frozen food freak and I'm very tolerant of non-fresh food, so TRUST ME when I say this stuff is terrible.  I'll barter the remaining cans for stuff I might actually eat.
Chips were ok but the box seen better days.shipped by u.s.p.s.
Great, I actually sent this box of chips to my Mom. She was extremely satisfied with the purchase.
contents inside sealed bags were stale and some had gotten moisture inside the bags
I should've read the reviews first they scammed me too, The description says big grab but they are the small one ounce bags
These are not big grab bags of chips. False advertising.
Not the big grab size, I was disappointed

When we received these they were stale. The expiration date for these were the week that we had received them, so we believed them to be edible. After distributing some to students as a finals week giveaway, we discovered that they were completely stale. We ended up wasting most of what we bought. We will not be purchasing large packs of chips from here again.

Just so everyone is aware...just because the chips are past the "sell by" date, does not mean that if you eat them you will look like the witch melting in the Wizard of Oz.  They will still be indiscernibly fresh for several months after.  I
fresh and good to eat for halloween time to give out...
The product you get is not what is pictured. You get the tiny bags and not the flavors shown. Will not be purchasing again.

Somewhere in the description, it says that the flavors may vary, at least when it was ordered for me.  So some reviewers have said that.  The overall variety is good, there are cheetos, bbq chips, regular chips, and other varieties.
Firto Lay "Big Grab" Classic Mix Variety is great!
It wasn't the " Big Grab". It was the small bags which was even more convenient and easy to grab.
I found the chips to be stale, but the rest of the chips were very good. I would still buy again.
i like every kind in here but the sour cream and onion , it arrived on time , i like the small bag they don't go stale as fast
I like the amount of chips for the price and the different kinds that were used in the box. I will purchase them again.
Love the variety mix of frito lay BIG GRAB! Perfect for packing lunches for the kids or adult snack time
It was the small bags that i purchase at sams for011.99 not the big bags . to forever to get here a  waste of time and money.

Great seller and also the chips were very fresh! I ate once in awhile as a snack but took them to work and left it in the break room and people were asking me how much they owed me for the chips I said just take whatever you want, they're for everybody.

Well, first let me say I would have given this product 5 stars, but I originally had issues with it. First, and I know the description does state that the chips may change, however it should not be only one bag of something displayed on the box. The box will not contain as many sour cream and bbq chips and you think it would. Its inundated with cheetos, doritos, etc. Second, they were rather on the stale side. I contacted the company and they gave me the option for a refund or another box. I selected another box and I told them that my favorites (sour cream and bbq) practically was void and the other bags were stale. The second box was much fresher but there was only 2 bags of sour cream chips and 2 bags of bbq chips. So, that is why I only gave it 4 stars. Otherwise, the company was humble and aimed to please.
So 4 stars because I would have loved to have the possibility of choosing my 50 bag of chips instead of having some bags that no one liked, but I still do like all the mix of chips I got.
I was supposed 2 get this 2 an 1/2 weeks ago, and i never recieved it... you got paid 4 it though, so now im short the money 4 it, an i don't have it...

Every chip was fresh down to the last one eaten.  I purchase the chips for my Sunday School Class.  Everyone enjoy-
ed them.  This is my thid t5ime buying and will continue to do the same when there is a need.

Product not the same as the picture.  The flavors were not the same as the picture.  Shipping was crap.  Not impressed at all... for 24 bucks.. Man what a scam.  These bags are tiny as f.  I got them in the middle of March and they expire the first week in April!  I have 2 weeks to eat 50 small bags of chips HAH.  What a mistake.

You receive all 50 bags of different flavor chips (as described) but the packaging does differ from the picture provided. Instead of one big box, the chips are packaged in a flat pack cardboard box, the top exposed, and wrapped in cellophane.

I liked it however I would have loved a little more variety such as salt and vinegar and barbecue chips!! :) maybe sour cream and onion just a little more variety!
other than that it was good
my grand kids loved it the perfect size for them just the snack size for them. we loved them and will purchase again when needed.
You Have To Be Careful If You On A Low Sodium Diet. This Not For You, It Has A Lot of Salt, Good But Salty.
They was fresh and good. I will order this product again. Thanks it was great. The bag was big like it said it would be.

I purchase this while I was in Afghanistan thinking I was going to actual get big grabs boy was I wrong they were small 1oz. packages was not a happy camper will not order these again..................

The bags in this variety pack are not 'Big Grab" bags as stated in the title. The value of this product is far less than it would have been if these were actually the much larger Big Grab bags. These small 1 oz. bags can be purchased for 20-25 cents each at various warehouse clubs. No bargain here.
The purchase was made thinking it would be a great deal for bulk purchase. Dates on the product were too close unless you are a user that would finish up in a 2-3 week period.

Ordered these pop ice freezer bars for our after school programs and could not be any less impressed! Two of our orders arrived with broken packages that caused them to leak sticky, brown liquid all over the rest of them. You may want to consider a better name brand in hopes that maybe for a little more, you get some quality package.
I sent these to Afghanistan to the Marines (who have access to a freezer) as they were one of the requested items on a wish list.  They arrived safe and sound and have been eaten.

Pops broken and leaking. Clearly known by shipper since box was placed in a ziplok bag. If you know it's going to break why spend a dollar on a ziplok bag instead of spending a dollar on real packing material that will result in a happy customer?
These taste really good. I'm an adult but I do love these. I hide them in my chest freezer from my adult sons. LOL
Small convenient size for little kids. A little small for adults though, but maybe that will help lower caloric intake.

I am addicted to these things. I love them. Did I mention I'm 43? Anyway, they are great. Only problem is that when they arrived, they were all melted. Not one was still frozen. Had to wait three hours to enjoy one after freezing. But seriously, why is the price going up every week? Are there more Pop Ice addicts out there buying them by the truck load like me?
These are a cheap alternative for summer when everyone wants a cold treat. Superior flavor and size than the Fla-Vor-Ice case.
Deliciously refreshing. They should replace the grape with the lemon flavor.
All three boxes were damaged and I am not allowed to return or get a refund.
Do NOT BUY it came covered in mold.
One of our packages had mold all over it and we had to throw it away.

These pop-ice's are delicious. Kids love them. They aren't as long as average freeze pops that usually come in the netted bag at the grocery store which might be a good thing for smaller children. But mine came in a sealed box and nothing leaked.
Item arrived soggy and in very poor condition. Upon inspection of the popsicles many were empty/leaking. Very dissatisfied.
They were ok. I thought I ordered Flavor Ice, but apparently I ordered pop ice instead. One of the boxes was leaking. It could have been better.
My son loves these and you can't buy them in the grocery in Upstate NY in the winter!
Great product. Great for parties or for home snacks whenever you like.
The pop ice arrived late and the box was leaking.  It appears that the pops were punctured.

A little expensive for simple ice pops but my local grocery store only carries the pops with the exotic/adventurous flavors. However, after ordering these on two separate occasions, they always arrive a mess with several pops open and leaking everywhere. They get the job done but I don't think the price and damage are worth it.

Great job, shipped to a military deployed location, arrived with-in 5 days of ordering. Package perfectly, none of them burst. I'll gladly give these out to the Airman as they work in the heat! Thanks again
It's always amusing to see things like this so far out there you have to question yourself for reading it wrong...But, if they sell them at that price....
Some freeze pops broke and wet other items in the package.  On a positive note, I got a refund from Amazon. One thing you can count on is that Amazon comes through when you have a complaint.
These are amazingly overpriced. They are very good, a bit small but way way overpriced here. Order the exact same thing from Walmart for $3

My daughter loves this type of frozen treat.  We ordered this 100 count box expecting them to be larger.  These freezer pops are actually half the size of the freezer pops that we are used to buying in the grocery stores.  Dissappointed with this purchase.
The popsicles are a bit small, they taste okay.  Otter pops are better for sure but these are okay in kid sized packets.
Not worth the price:  only half the size of the standard pops.  Do not buy unless you're willing to get half of what you paid for.

I bought these while I was deployed. It was a great treat after working out in the hot sun. Dinged one star, because the flavor was weaker in comparison to other pops I've had before. But it was a great value.

When I was a kid, this is the summer tradition. We couldn't keep them in stock at my grandparents house. Now that I have young children, we have blown through several boxes of these this past summer. I'll admit that I ate about 75% of them. But when you're a parent of 4 kids under 8 years of age, you can tell them they can only have one. ;)
Iced sugar water for my 2-year-old.  I keep a handful in the freezer, and they never fail to disappoint.  The little guy loves them.
One of my favorite childhood memories: Love the product and I search often for them.  Product is as I expected....item arrived on time, if not early.  No need to contact seller. A++++
bought it for my toddlers but even my husband loves them. good flavor and keeps them cool in the hot florida summer.

I was a little surprised by some of the really harsh reviews I've seen so far as well as some of the claims they don't fit the nespresso machine. I have the Delonghi Latissima (the older one, not the new square one released last year) and while it takes a little bit more force to close the door, compatibility has not been a problem. It's hard for me to imagine it fits one machine and not the others...
As for the coffee, it's OK- doesn't compete with that amazing vanilla seasonal variation nespresso released this past year, but it's not as bad as the cherry variation either. Its definitely not as strong as the Ristretto or the Appreggio but has much more flavor then the cosi and some other the other weaker blends. I would most compare it to one of the new Lungo blends taken as a short pour instead of the lung pour.
I have found them adequate to make my daily cappuccinos and honestly worth saving 30% per capsule vs nespresso. I will buy more!

This is the second ECC product I have reviewed. Out of the two I liked this the best and felt it was really similar to the Nespresso I have been drinking for awhile.  I think it is a milder version but I prefer that for this flavor.  I have had this flavor three days in a row and I seem to be a little less jittery compared to the Nespresso version. I would give this flavor a try and judge for yourself but I do think it is a good product with a good story.
I received the Espresso Capsules and I love the fact that they are biodegradable. The espresso tastes great! Great purchase.

I have tried the Cremoso and the Espressivo and love them both.  Great for a quick pick me up in the morning and early afternoon - the taste is perfect for me.  Im not one to love extremely bitter espresso's and this has just the right amount of humph!  Another great thing i do with them when it is hot out (and where I from, it gets extremely hot) is pour the espresso in a glass with some almond milk and lots of ice. So refreshing!
Bonus is that the capsules are biodegradable - one should always go that route when deciding what to buy.

My office recently bought a DeLonghi Espresso machine, along with many varieties of espresso capsules to try out.  I was very excited as my love (and pickiness) of coffee and espresso has gone back many years since my first trip to France.  My definite favorite is the Cremoso from Ethical Coffee Company.  My mid-afternoon treat has quickly become a Cremoso double latte.  The aroma and the taste are wonderful, and it is the perfect pick-me-up to get through the rest of my day.  I have ordered a box of Cremoso to have at my desk as my own personal "stash".  My co-workers like several of the other varieties of Ethical Coffee, but my hands-down favorite is Cremoso.  An added bonus is that Ethical Coffee Company (the name says it all, doesn't it?) makes their capsules envinronmentally-friendly and biodegradable. I have been concerned about the millions of plastic capsules that are mounting up in our landfills. I will always support a company that combines great quality with integrity, and Ethical Coffee Company seems to be the only company in the coffee genre that does.

I really liked the idea of a cheaper capsule than Nespresso offer, with free shipping via Amazon Prime. Also I thought that the other reviewers were just being a bit sensitive, after all, coffee is coffee right?
Uhhhh, no... I really should have listened to the other reviewers.
Yes it's cheaper and yes it worked just fine in my machine, and gave a fine crema but no I would *NEVER* buy this again.
It tasted like a very weak, watered down, version of the real thing.

I guess you get what you pay for - save yourself the money, buy the real Nespresso capsules and don't get stuck with 50 capsules of coffee that you are not going to drink (yuck!) and can't return.

Oh well... Lesson learnt.
These capsules do NOT fit the DeLonghi Nespresso machines. The company indicated that they do not make a coversIon kit either.

Hi,  Does anyone know if these espresso "pods" work with a Keuric (sp?) machine or just the Nespresso device? Figured I could buy them to use at work.  These guys drink so much coffee they probably wouldn't notice how they tasted.  Thanks!  I appreciate any help I can get.  Don't want to deal with the hassle of returning if they don't work in our machine.

New Update, Well as it turns out the Ethical Coffee Company has came through. They contacted me about the problem I had and have replaced my machine, so they do stand behind their word and will honor their guarantee. It took a few weeks but they did what they said they would. Therefore I will continue to use their products.

Delicious espresso. I was hesitant based on some of these reviews but had to give it a try.
No problems with the capsules fitting. I am using a Gran Maestria.  There is a little popping sound as described by ECC but in my machine it is quite faint.  No problems closing. You have to give it a more firm push than the Nespresso capsules.
The flavor is rich and substantial enough for use in a latte or cap.  I have tried it as an Americano as well and it works for me.
At this price what's not to like?
Enjoy!

I bought all five of the different types of Ethical coffee capsules made for Nespresso machines.  Unfortunately,

1. Coffee flavor-marginal-not great
2. Quantity of Coffee-less in capsule than in Nespresso capsule
3. We have a brand new Nespresso Pixie. These capsules continue to get jammed in the machine and we have to reach in, struggle with the capsule to pry it loose before we can make another coffee.
4. Since 10 capsules are packaged in one plastic sleeve, the moment we open the sleeve, air comes into contact with the remaining capsules minimizing their freshness.

Bottom line is that the espresso coffee is not worth the lower cost to purchase these capsules.

First off, the pods jam in my (brand new!) Nespresso Pixie.  Its easy enough to clear the jam, but they should work without a screwdriver. Secondly, the coffee isn't very good.

As much as a like a lower priced option, I have to suggest you stick with the authentic Nespresso pods.

So as a espresso fan, and a Nespresso owner for the last few years, I was excited when I heard about these capsules... but after trying them, I was not impressed. If you just want coffee and don't like it strong and don't pay much attention to the flavor, these should be fine. If good flavor and strength matter... don't buy these.

I thought I would give these a try since the nespresso caps are so tasty hence we go thru them quickly. Thought I would try a knock off for half the price. NOT worth it! Stick with the real thing or try another alternative because these are WEAK, WATERY and YUCKY. Maybe if I was try to ween myself off a nespresso habit but I am not so I do not enjoy them at all. :(
I tried the 3 strongest options and they were all week. Had to do short pulls and a 3:1 ratio was still not equal to 1 weak nespresso cap.
The shipping and service was great, just not the product. Plus to add insult, they dropped the price from 25$ a box down to 10$. At $10 try them yourself and you can taste disappointing brown water too!

When I bought these they worked out to about half the price of Nespresso pods.  I thought it was a great deal until I tasted the first shot.  This particular variety at least is VERY weak.  I ended up using two pods per shot and it still isn't as strong nor full flavored like genuine Nespresso pods (even something mild like a 3 or 4 intensity).
My wife said they tasted like plastic and wouldn't even drink them. Also I had some trouble with them jamming in the machine, but learned to just eject them immediately after it was done.  This was with a Pixie machine.  In short, don't waste your money.

I'm not exactly an espresso connoisseur, so I have a hard time telling a huge difference between these capsules and the nespresso ones in drinks like lattes. Unfortunately, for less diluted drinks, the weaker flavor in these capsules was pretty obvious. They're not so much weaker that they're undrinkable, but they're definitely have less flavor.

At the previous price of 25 cents/capsule, these were an awesome choice for lattes/cappuccinos, but for 50 cents/capsule, I'll just stick with the nespresso capsules.

I am NOT a coffee snob but this is clearly NOT espresso either.  I have a almost new Citiz I used to prepare the drink.  Half way through the brewing process, the coffee is coming out light brown.  The coffee tasted like diluted weak coffee with no body or espresso aroma.  There was no crema either.  I tried it again with new capsules to make sure that the first one wasn't a defective capsule- same result.  Amazon does not accept return for this item.

OK, so this is not Nespresso swiss coffee. It is however, very drinkable and smooth and a perfect antidote to those SKY HIGH Nespresso capsule prices (hello, Nespresso, are you listening). I am eagerly waiting for Starbucks to come out with their espresso capsule machine later this year - it's going to be a category killer!! But until then, I'll mix this coffee in sometimes (after dinner) and be none the worse for it. Thanks Ethical Coffee!!!

What attracted me was the savings over Nespresso capsules...I so wanted to like these, but the extraction is inadequate and espresso is weak and not as nuanced as most Nespresso varieties.  Since I paid $25 for the 5 boxes of 10 each, the price has dropped precipitously...now under $15.  I can only believe that despite the pretty package and the eco-friendly claims, Nespresso users will pay a significant price premium to get the consistenly good (if not great), no mess aspects of using Nespresso capsules.  I am reluctant to try other flavors after my experience with Cremoso.

I use Nespresso Roma, and my wife uses Nespresso Ristretto.  We bought Cremosa and Espressivo as possible substitutes, because lower per-capsule price, free shipping with my Amazon Prime, and I don't have to use the Outpresso to recycle.  But we don't like the coffee. Others may prefer it, I'm sure, but its not for us. Too weak,  and we don't like the flavor.  The Cremosa is especially watery versus Nespresso.  I'm cheap and maybe not as picky  so I will use them up over time, but after trying both Cremosa and Espressivo, my wife will have none of it.  One of life's little pleasures especially for her is good coffee, and these are no substitute.

I did like the taste of this bar, but I thought (from the description of the bar that was given) that it was going to have more of a crunch to it. It was too chewy, I wanted it more crunchy. Other than that it was ok.

Ordered these cos I love the cashew ones and i love coffee. They are pretty good. Love that they are not too sweet. All the protein/ energy bars I have tried are sickly sweet which is really off putting. Not sure how good they are for you but they meake you feel really full for a while. Will buy again.
Ordered two 16 bar boxes.  Each contained 15 bars
I got jipped. This was supposed to be a 16 count, and I only got 14
I didn't like the flavor. I'd recommend the peanut butter chocolate chip flavor over this. The batch I got tasted old and flavorless.

Larabars are the perfect little snack- tastes like a treat but made from real food. I always keep a box on hand so I can grab one before leaving the house so if hunger strikes between meals I have something on hand to help beat temptation.

I must have misread the label. I didn't realize it said Labrador. Because what came inside tastes like it came out from one of their rear ends. These need to be buried in the backyard and someone needs to be called a "bad dog"!!
delicious, nutritious and a hint of cappuccino which goes splendidly with my morning cup of coffee.
Thanks for the flavor that not many stores sell!

Horrible taste
It's lemony, pretty gross when lemons are mixed with cappuccino
I love Larabar products, but this flavor is just not up to par.
I love these, it's a delicious and healthy afternoon snack that satisfies my sweet tooth.

I love Larabars, every flavor. Except this one. Usually, Larabar will amaze me with how accurately they can make flavors, like Blueberry muffin, Mint chip brownie, Pineapple upside down cake, etc. But they missed the mark on this cappuccino one. Not so great.

I love Larabars with a passion, but unfortunately this wasn't a flavor that I really enjoyed.  I love coffee, so I was surprised that I actually disliked it.  I think I wanted something a little sweeter and this bar, to me, just kind of tastes like plain black coffee.  I still love Larabars, but I'll be sticking to other flavors.
quality item but not my favorite flavor...coffee is too strong for me, but hubby likes :)

Quite good, not my favorite Larabar flavor, but that's only because there are so many fabulous ones to choose from. This one has the flavor of black coffee mixed with the sweetness of the dates. Very good, but kinda like if you take a sip of coffee without cream when you were expecting cream. But really is quite good... maybe 4 1/2 stars would be a more accurate rating for me. :)
its o.k. a good strong coffe flavor..only for he coffe lovers...

We love larabars, but this cappuccino flavor is absolutely terrible.  It literally tastes like you're eating coffee grinds.  We have an entire box that we are throwing in the trash because they are so bad.  Stick to the other flavors which are excellent.
All of the flavors are great but the cappuccino is my absolute favorite
Not my favorite flavor for larabars. BUt it's good and simple. Nice snack.

As far as Larabars go, these were pretty terrible. The flavor wasn't awful, but the coffee grounds in my mouth were. My husband and I each had 1, and now we're looking to give away the other 14. Stick with the fruit flavors.
Wasn't terrible tasting. Would be better with chocolate mixed in.
