If you're trying to play 3d games on a regular ds this will not work. This will only work with games that were meant for the console your playing on. This will need forced applied on it or else it will not read
Very useful. Never gonna lose my games and I don't have to keep switching them out. Also slim enough to not take up that much space in your pocket. Package was opened and tampered with though.
Made for the DS Lite, but works well in others. There's a gap on the 3DS between the console and the switcher, I put some tape between to pad it. Works with 3DS games!
It won't stay on for ANYTHING, causing the game to get disconnected. Save your money.
It falls out easily so you have to hold it in place.
this product did not work at all and i was very disappointed in the quality of the product as it appeared to be of low quality

I would LOVE to love this product, but alas I cannot! The concept of it is great! Being able to have 3 games on your DS and with a switch of a button move between them is cool.

However there is a MAJOR drawbacks! First I shall say that I used this on my 3DS XL. You cannot have a case on your DS with this plugged in the game slot. You CANNOT move your DS while playing your game because it clicks out of the slot VERY VERY easily! The games are very hard to get out of this thing! Which is awesome while the games are in their slots because you know that they won't fall out, but not great when you need to take a game out of it. It does weigh your DS down a bit, but is tolerable I suppose.

Would I recommend buying this? No I would not. Save your money for something else, like a new game!
If I don't apply pressure super-specifically, the game card disconnects and that just ruins it. Seriously, do not buy this.

I purchased two of these: one for me, one for my friend. They both work, but the one he got is a little more touchy. It's still a cool accessory for the nintendo ds though! Fits well on both my 3ds xl and his regular sized 3ds.
This item is a great concept but does not function properly. It will work for a few minutes but becomes useless with the slightest movement.

I really enjoy the convenience of this! i love being able to switch between the three games. Only one shows up on the main screen, and there is a switch on the back to choose which one you want to play. The switch has just the right amount of resistance to prevent accidental sliding while playing a game.
However, the insert is spring loaded almost, you have to be REALLY careful, because any pressure on the game selector instead of the L or R buttons will cause the Game Selector to be ejected, and your game will be ended with no warning. Since I play games such as Animal Crossing and Pokemon, this ends my game, promptly erasing hours of data that i was too focused on to stop for 5 seconds and save.
That is the only draw back as  i can tell, and the Game Selector doesn't add too much bulk to the actual DS console itself.
works great. just what we needed to keep from losing our games by laying them around. Exactly what I was looking for.
I tried this product with both my 3ds and my ds lite systems and neither of them worked at all! I wish I had gotten my money back.
Really cool, works with 2D and 3D games. Would recommend to anyone who likes Nintendo DS game systems! Yeah yeah!

It did work reading the games and switching between them, but every tiny bump made it completely stopped reading the game, so i had to reset and lost all my data quite a few times before i ditched it ): It's a good idea, but this particular item didn't work very good like i thought it would
This is AWESOME! No more fumbling around trying to switch between three game cartridge! Now I pop in three different games and after saving I can switch between games!

Great little product by a brand name company. Plugged it into the 3DS and voila! 3 games at my teen's fingertips :D. The only complaint and I mean only one is that the case does not fit over the unit when attached. Other than that it is a hit!

Read some of the reviews on this item and figured I would have some of the same problems but thought it would be a part time problem.  I was wrong.  It was not worth the problem.  The games are hard to change out of each spot.  The entire game case comes out with a slight touch.  Then you have to restart the system to get the games to register.  If you hate to change games in and out for your child you will hate this even more.  It doesn't save any time.
This product does work as advirtised but it does add some bulkeness to the system other than that it works great!
This was so ideal for my kids dsi i have a 5 yr old son and a 2 yr old daughter it is so easy for them to play and keep track of their Love Love Love it
Unless your a genus on alien life forms and alien technology you will not get this game and understand how to win. Too difficult to deal with not knowing what techs to research and how to win.

This game must be downloaded by Steam. This is a slow process. Worse, Steam says it will only download once and the download got wiped out by a Windows  security update. All unused items were wiped from my computer as potential Virus carriers. I am displeased with Microsoft and disillusioned with Steam which I will NEVER use again!

This is a sg keeps you on the edge yet calm, and relex you. It is for a fan of Sid Meirs games. I like it worth buying it, also good graphics for these types of games. Give it a try you won't be dissapointed

This game is buggy af.  At first I thought maybe I was missing a patch, but Steam takes care of those updates... or so tech support tells me.  I checked teh interwebz and other players report some of the same problems.  I probably wouldn't buy another these considering how unstable it is.
I love the Civilization series of games and Beyond Earth is no exception.

This is another great title in Sid Meier's Civilization series.  The graphics and animation are beautiful.  The variety of planets and landscape is great.  This game introduces a new, non-linear technology web, and it also introduces new concepts in diplomacy, affinity, and cultural synergies.  The one glaring flaw I find is with the AI players.  The good: each seems to have its own unique personality and affinities characteristics.  The bad: the AI players often do not act in a rational or logical manner.  As with other iterations of Civilization, the AI players can go from being your friend to being your enemy and declaring war in one turn, and with no warning.

I've played through it several times, and the AI is not enough to make this a bad game, but it could use some improvement, in my opinion.
Did not catch the fact that you need a steam account to use.
I ran into issues many others have expressed online. The terrain becomes overly pixelated and glitchy to the point I haven't been able to play it.

This game is so counterintuitive that it makes it too much of a chore to play. As my first 'civilization' game I may be handicapped but the tutorial is no help and give instructions to select options but does not show where those options are or what the icon looks like. I could not do anything to progress in the game and after only a few turns I gave up and finally just threw the game in the trash. I have never been more frustrated with a video game in my entire life.

The game concept is pretty good However, the flaw is the delivery method (network). If they truly would allow stand-alone game play, it would be awesome.

STEAM servers constantly overload, slowing down & locking up the game.

Redo the game & simply let us play w/out  forcing us to rely on the network.
I love this game!  I love the new type of tech tree, I love the graphics and pretty much everything about this game.  I have long been a Civ player and they just keep getting better.

It was a fun novelty, and had a lot of interesting new content and ideas within the Civilization framework. They got more right than they got wrong, but there was just enough wrong in it for me to take a star away. I hated that there was a maximum turn limit no matter what, it really put a damper on certain types of gameplay styles.
Doesnt work on windows 10, for a TON of reasons.  Tried verifiying files, updating video drivers.  I can get the older "civ V" to work fine, but this one...not once.
Boring, looks like a cheap attempt to sell another product....
The civilization style with different graphics and names/etc.  It's fun and a good deal.
VERY much like the old game "Alpha Centauri" -- have always wanted to get a copy of that game but this one is even better...

If you like buggy software you'll love it, otherwise skip it.  Even on easy level only perhaps 1 of 6 games are playable the rest have to many obstacles to let you even get started.  Poorly thought out and even more poorly written,
Got blank screens requiring reboot while playing game online.

Take Civ 5, remove everything that made each civilization unique, then reskin it as a "space" game and you've got Beyond Earth.  Actually, Beyond Earth is worse than that -- they don't have good quotes from historical figures or books; instead they're made up nonsense from fictitious people in the game.  You land on the planet and found your first city, but you have no idea what the map looks like because your astronauts are too stupid to take a few photos from space before landing.  There are fewer victory types available -- for example, cultural victory and diplomatic victory have been removed in this game.
My dad had Rising Tides & needed this in order to play it. I gave it to him for his birthday.
Not as good as Civilization 5, but still a very fun game where you can spend hours of your time. The game is well made and fun to play if you love strategy.

Now that i have had the time to get acquainted with the moves of the game, I enjoy it. I am new at this type of turn based play. It has a number of game settings on which to play. Time moves along quickly. I am very satisfied with this version.
Fun game. Compared to Civ games, it's not quite at that level, but that may be because I'm not as familiar with this title yet. I enjoy Beyond Earth though. Challenging but fun.
Civ V was a much better game.  Save your money for Civ 6

After putting in about 70 hours, I am done.  I have tried, and tried, and tried again to like this game.  I'm a huge space nut; what can I say?  But in the middle of trying, a buddy asked if I wanted to play Civ V again.  It was like a breath of fresh air.  That playthrough called into question everything that is wrong with this game, and I don't recommend Beyond Earth in the slightest at this point.  It is too confusing; the basic combat unit advancement removes a huge part of research (units); the tech tree is not well done; the resources are used extensively or not at all; the list goes on.  It really was a good attempt.  There are varied and interesting map enhancements, and the unique units are interesting enough (but do not have enough unique abilities to make the anything other than better units), and obviously the setting is something that is not done well enough.

But I keep going back to Civ 5 ever since my buddy asked.  Says a lot.... My suggestion is to wait until Civilization 6 comes out and find a mod that puts a sci-fi skin on it.

Lot of potential here for Alien/Predator/all the classic Sci Fi.nothing like that here.

All the edifying bits of wisdom from Civ5, GONE, replaced with gibberish.
Strategic view, GONE, now its a mess of useless animations.
Save your money, save your time, don't reward the people that ruined this game.

Fun game that continues the civilization saga.

That being said, you need to research all of the new techs/alien life/game mechanics. This isn't as easy as picking up a copy of Civ V.

Don't buy runs off steam platform. Don't know what steam is its dog crap software designed to make you mad. It updated for me once and 6 months later and I still can't login and play. Google steam login problems or steam software problems. You won't buy after that.
DO NOT BUY A USED COPY OF THIS PROGRAM. A product code is required which can only be used once. The previous owner will have used this code, so you'll be left with a game you can't play.
The game is OK.  Wish you can create you own units with different tech.
Awful gameplay. I loved Civ 4 but since then it just keeps getting worse.
I bought this as a gift, and the recipient is very happy with it.
Requires Steam which is horrible. I still have not been able to play because of problems with Steam. Pathetic.
My fianc LOVES it and often remarks on the game's surprisingly thoughtful and insightful strategies!

The overall is fine , nice graphics. However, the Tech tree is all crazy stuff that has not hardly even been thought of, (like alien tech n such..), thus I played a few games and got bored of not knowing the tech tree and a way to even do well

if you're buying this in the expectation that it will be easy loading and running, you're in for a disappointment.  There's this thing called Steam which appears to be an additional interface that is needed to run the game, slowing the computer way down to the point where, on my pc, I was never able to view the game, though Steam informed me the game was running.  I really loved Alpha Centauri and Alien Crossfire, but this was a huge letdown.  Windows isn't enough to run the stupid game?

Game is a lot of fun.  Some of the new skills to learn took a bit to learn, but overall was simple enough to understand.  In some ways yes it did feel like a reskinned Civilization 5, but it still has me coming back for more, the old just one more click and then about 20 clicks later you are ok now I'm shutting it down.  If you like previous civilizations then chance is you will like this one as well.
Interesting expansion on Civilization 5, game play very similar, though new and fresh design
Latest sci/fi Civilization  games installment from Sid Meier. Works on Win 7 systems.
Bought as a gift. My fiance enjoyed this installment in the series.

Best of the civilization games since Civ 2.  Still miss the throne room and wonder movies, would have given 5* if the devs would have given those back.  Far more detailed and interesting game then Civ5.  I expect those that think it's the same as Civ5 either haven't spent much time playing both or just don't bother with much thought or strategy in there play styles.  Easiest level players perhaps?  Great game, impressive tech tree.  Variable degrees of help from advisor very nice for experienced Civ players new to this game.
Basically Civ 5 with cosmetic changes; some of the diplomatic dialogue is identical to Civ 5.  Very disappointed.
Yet another great iteration of the Cavitation franchise.
Not nearly as fun as other CIV games but definitely more complicated.
A lot of fun to play for civ fans

this is crap I buy the Disk so I don't have to use a 3rd party program to play. and it says on box steam needed to install game.  no indication that steam needed to play game. yet clicking the icon opens steam (I had it closed deliberately) and game does not run without it.  this is false advertisement. by the packing licences on the outside of the box.  if i was going to buy as a download type program I would have gotten the better package for a discount on newer addon game it has.
The improvements and change of venue make it worthwhile.
I've been playing Civilization for a number of years and really enjoy this new version.  I recommend to all civilization fans.

I have been a Civ player since the old Dos days. This is a good game, with the classic Civilization style play. But it feels like something is missing. I've only been playing a few months, but I'll play this, then go back and play Civ V for a couple days. I just can't seem to get the Civ feel from this game like the classics all had, including V. I wish they would have made this as an add onto Civ V, so you could have moved into space from earth as you earned it, etc. True Civ style.
It was bought for a gift and the receiver loves it.

This game is way less fun, and much less polished than Civ V.  If you already have Civ V, don't bother with Beyond Earth.  If you don't, buy Civ V instead - way more fun, cheaper.  Hugely disappointing.

Civilization has to be one of my 10 favorite franchises over the past 30 years and has brought me possibly thousands of hours of entertainment and great memories.

This game honestly was disappointing and does not live up to the Civ name. It was tedious, lacked the depth of Civ V, and is really a watered-down, poorly done skin on Civ V. I wish I had never bought it.
Excellent game, absorbing gameplay.  Like eating potato chips once you start it's hard to stop!
For the game, i didn't really like it. But the shipment was fast.

My wife loves this genre and this one is one of the best. Lots of actions and excitement (yes, she was excited!). She played Sid Meier's in PS3 for years and there were no new games.
If you love this genre, definitely try this one.
My only gripe is that the disc doesn't really work since Steam ignored it and download everything. It was a long install.
Disappointed as explained to shipper JAZZ but kept the game anyhow even though my Grandson did not want micro LEGOs.

would be an awesome game without the tracking and all around bad steam software application that you have to install and have running to use...but as it is mandatory...I cannot recommend a product that has to have a third party app even to run buy anything else but this. maybe the programmers will take note that offline games should not need and online part just to start and run and it takes up space , runs slow too bad as I own all the Cid meiers games. but this will be my last that I ever buy because of steam. fix this or lose another customer..i do not like having tracking software installed on my machine. turned in to antivirus makers as a malware app

I expected more.  I was hoping for a really sophisticated universe-based game akin to the old Masters of Orion Games.  Instead, its almost exactly like other Civilization games with futuristic names and aliens instead of barbarians--really disappointing.

Another problem I have with Civilization games is they're all now Steam-based, even if you buy the CD/DVD version.  You can't even play the game without Internet and a Steam account.  One of the reasons I got into Civ games was they were playable when I didn't have access to the Internet as a fun way to pass time in a hotel or in other situations when Internet was not readily available.  Honestly, when the Internet is on, there's almost always something better to read/do/play.

I wouldn't buy this again, I doubt I'd play it on Steam even if it were free.  If it were playable offline, I'd give it 3 stars for fitting its niche where I needed it--but still failing to meet my expectations as a new game.

This is a re-hash of Civilization V with new skins for old game mechanics.  It is no great feat to beat the game, and a simple and nearly guaranteed path to victory is hard-coded into it.

But worse still, 2K/Firaxis has patched the game to the point that it is unplayable on many systems with NVidia graphics cards that exceeded the both the minimum and recommended requirements, and doesn't seem to care.  This is my LAST purchase of a 2K/Firaxis game, and I am submitting a request for a full and complete refund, as the implied warranty of merchantability has been voided by the manufacturer. . .
Seems kind of like a re-skin of Civ V, although I do like some of the new features such as the tech tree "web", affinities, trade routes, and unit upgrades

Great game if you love the Civ series.  It really could have been called Civ 6: Alien Encounters :)

While the inability to stack units is still a bit weird, it doesn't detract from the game in any way.

I applaud the "fit in with your environment" aspect, but it is played a little heavy handedly by the other civilizations.  I've played through several times and don't ever remember one of the other Civ leaders saying "Good thing you blasted those aliens out of the way."  Thus I tend to build around the nests rather than over them.
My son loves it and is challenging for him.

Not a great CIV game compared to previous ones...nothing new or exciting, just some confusing new Tech tree and renaming of Countries to Corporations which land on a planet.. Game play feels "clunky" and there are bugs. I would wait till this game goes on sale before I would buy this.. I made the classic mistake of falling for the hype and advertising.

This game has not worked since it was received - it will not load although both computers we tried it on met all parameters. My son has tried to contact Steam regarding the issue and was directed to Twitter! No customer service whatsoever from 2K or Steam. They have released several "patches" that still don't address the problem.
Wasn't great.  Sid Meier's Civ lost something!  I have played them all.
Great next edition of a fantastic series of games.
I've been addicted to the game since I've installed it. I am disappointed that the boxed version still requires Steam to run it though, but a great, fun game despite having to use Steam.

Weakest Civ game yet. It is not building on some of the best parts as the last few Civs. As a big Civ fan, I am sad to say this is the weakest game in the series. And it MOST definitely is not Alpha Centauri 2.
it was a huge dissapointment -this is not what one should expect from Sid

Such a basic game hard to believe waited so long for something like this. Graphic are good but otherwise can't say much for it and I've playing civ since civ2. Not many opponents,engineers, merchants, etc I'm used to in a civ game. I really can't believe Sid Meier put his name on this.

Similar concept to previous versions... I have to figure out the tech tree, kind of confusing and not a really good format to know HOW to pursue tech or military or cultural... you have discern it from the way it is presented and some of the options offered within each choice... just as addictive as V and other versions... On trades, you get 'favors', I have no idea how to call those up or when they are used or how... no good explanation on wonders so I keep 'wondering' if it is worth it and what will you get from it...

Don't regret the purchase, but not 'that' much better....

Definitely a worth addition to the Sid Meyer's Civ games. More of a sequel to Alpha Centauri than Civilization V however. It is still very fun and adds quite an interesting new mix of game mechanics and playstyle options. I find myself playing this game very differently than how I normally play Civ 5 games, which is good. A must buy for any fan to the Civilization series, or Sid Meyer's games all together.

Game would not install either by a too early game release or issues with the required STEAM site.
Too many problems.  Save your money until these bugs are removed.
I have worked with 2K to remove these issues.  Although they are helpful is this to be expected
following an expensive purchase?

It is more like an expansion pack than a new game.  Diplomacy functions much the same as Civ V with the addition of exchanging "favors." .  Also the spy interface is updated with more options.  I like the ability to terraform the landscape and the planetary resources are new and different.  Once you adjust to thelandscape you it will feel very much like you are playing Civ V.  Instead of barbarians there are aliens.  Instead of happiness there is health to contend with.  One of my favorite aspects of this game is the automatic unit upgrades as your technologies advance.  Take advantage of trade routes to have ample resources to support units and buildings.  The technology "web" is somewhat confusing though well thought out.  Good job overall.  Four new and interesting ways to win in addition to domination victory.

Hidden on separate 'system requirements' page: Requires internet activation and patch download. Should have been listed both on the box and clearly stated on Amazon sales page. Fail to both 2k and Amazon.
I brought this game for my little brother and he loves it!
A large disappointment.  I had hoped that it would be in the style of his other games.

I have found the game to be counter productive. The aliens are very aggressive. They attack at every chance. Normally I would build up my defenses and defend myself or even wipe them out entirely. I haven't gotten that far but there are indications they are important later in the game and I should leave them alone. This takes a lot of enjoyment out of the game. Every time I try to explore or advance my Civ. the aliens are there to attack.
can't even play cause when I load it the screen goes black. but, because I had to use the code to load it I can't return. This will be the last steam game I ever buy. back to the 360 for me... POS

this long awaited sequel to alpha centauri definitely lives up to the hype. we've had the game since the release date, and have already logged many many hours into gameplay. for fans of alpha centauri [the original] or the civ games, this game is perfect for you. the game was pre-ordered just a few days before the actual release date and was delivered right on time. I would definitely recommend this game.

I absolutely loved Civ 5 and I was really looking forward to Beyond Earth.  I'm not disappointed with the game or with buying it at full price, but I do think that it still feels like a DLC.

Truthfully, I'd wait for it to go on sale before you pick it up in its current state.  There are some bugs (nothing breaking thankfully) and I think that more content needs to be available to really help it live up to bar set by Civ 5 and  the hours & hours you can spend there.

This is a preliminary rating.  I have attempted the game several times so far and was very pleased with the way it played and the concept of the game.  The graphics are rather blurry and dark, unlike previous versions.  The problem that I have with the game is that it could not be completed.  Twice I went all the way through the research  and in spite of have the requisite object in place for the victory for over 50 turns it would not complete the victory.  There was no way to get help on the 2K site though there was a page to ask for help, it would not allow me to enter anything.  I have been playing the Civilization games since the first and have found them enjoyable.  This may be only a problem with the type of victory I attempted so will keep trying.  If it works I may change the rating.
Fun. Mostly what you'd expect. Some new features, a lot of old features remain, yet had their names changed. Not enough work was put into the AI, although remains decent. 7.5/10.

Haven't been able to play it yet, so the one star is my frustration in trying to get it to run.  Could be I'm just stupid and I can accept that.  Besides being stupid, I am not sure what the issues are.  My problems may be with Steam, which you have to use.  Other games I run through them work.  This one does not.  My computer meets tech requirements.  I have corresponded with them twice, but no answer beyond the automated FAQ response.  Black hole of tech support..  Others do not have this problem so............................  I give up for the time being..

Classics of the genre. Probably the most beautiful of all the games in the series, "Civilization", it is difficult to name a new subspecies of the series, most likely I would say about this game as a reincarnation of good old "Alpha Centauri" (fans will remember this game from Sid Meier). The game is very beautiful, with a nice initial videos, but the game is still buggy (sometimes by itself "hangs" (treated only by closing the process in Task Manager)).
